title: Ubisoft Connect game list not loading
body:
### Bug description

Having installed Ubisoft Connect through Lutris and logged in properly, the list of games will not load on the latest git master, though it loads fine on v0.5.10-beta1. Seems to be related to commit 4db540ccbd712c7a04d84c001ea3edfea5d09ceb.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Ubisoft Connect' under Sources. The game list is empty.
2. Click on the reload button.
3. See an error box simply saying 'ownedPlatformGroups'.

### Expected behavior

Load the Ubisoft Connect owned game list.

### Log output

title: Installation freezes with return code 256
body:
### Bug description

If you try to install a game, the installer of which, by the end of the installation (when everything was succesfully copied), crashes on exit, Lutris will get a "Exit with return code 256" and get stuck.
Best way to reproduce this is to try installing "Freelancer" game.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Acquire an iso of Freelancer (https://ia803100.us.archive.org/21/items/Freelancer_201807/Freelancer.iso)
2. Use CDROM installer for freelancer (https://lutris.net/games/freelancer/)
3. Mount ISO, follow installer's instructions (autodetect ISO)
4. Select express install
5. Wait until install finishes
6. Close the installer window by clicking on "X" button in the top right corner.
7. Get the return code 256 and stuck install

### Expected behavior

I expect that Lutris continues the installation, regardless of return code

title: Library is not refreshed after a new game is installed
body:
### Bug description

If you install a new game (I used #1 "A Test" installer), the library does not refresh to show a new entry in the library.
The new game only shows up if I switch between different tabs, "Games" and "Recent", for example.


### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install a new game
2. Finish installation
3. Check library after that
4. Switch between different tabs, "Games" and "Recent", for example
5. Game now shows up

### Expected behavior

I expect that the game shows up in the library immediately after installation and is sorted in proper order

### Log output

title: Lutris leaves behind dead winedevice processes
body:
How to reproduce:
1) Launch a Wine game through Lutris
2) Stop it
Result: all wine processes are killed but winedevice.exe, which persists and can only be terminated via "sigkill".

I am not really sure why this happens, I haven't looked at our process monitoring code but just using wineserver to shut things down shouldn't leave any processes behind.

title: Installer fails for gog games with a provider but no gogid
body:
### Bug description

When you run the installer, it freezes just before the file selection screen.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97908325/153111251-b5eea9dc-8756-4e46-b401-93c98250da20.png)

Might be related to https://github.com/lutris/lutris/issues/4016. Different cause of the error, but maybe triggering the same UI problem.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log in to GOG through Lutris.
2. Go to 'https://lutris.net/games/140/
 -   It can be any game that **has a gog provider game** associated, but **does not have a `gogid`**
      ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97908325/153111345-8e3bf8b6-7308-41b5-ac0a-c69e1a5d68f1.png)
2. Click on 'Install' for the gog installer
3. In the lutris install dialog which pops up, click 'install' twice (to confirm the installer, then to confirm the installation path)

title: Gamescope fails to run with mangohud
body:
### Bug description

If use mangohud with gamescope, game will fail to run. It is bug behind mangohud, and mangohud already made fix - `mangoapp` for using it in gamescope (mangohud pre-release 0.6.6, so it isn't in repos yet). Also there is workaround to get it working now.

`MANGOHUD=0 gamescope -- mangohud %command%`

https://github.com/Plagman/gamescope/issues/400#issue-1125182636

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Enable gamescope
2. Enable mangohud
3. Start game (some games work )
4. Game fails to run

title: Bottom panel switches to a different game when it stops
body:
If another game is running and you switch to a different one, and the first game is closed by itself (like quitting it manually, closing the game window), not through Lutris, the bottom panel will switch to that stopped game all by itself, without user's interaction:
![Peek 2022-02-04 13-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10602045/152513690-224ef6c1-b56f-4510-9d0f-897ffe2dd8ea.gif)

It should be noted that so far, only I can reproduce this, for some bizarre reason.

title: Lutris shell script generation leaves out overrides based on DLL selection for the runner
body:
### Bug description

Executing `lutris -b /some/path.sh lutris:write-script/<some game>` generates environment variables and templates them into a shell script that is supposed to be suitable for starting the game. Because of the order that the environment is built in this method, the runner doesn't undergo its `prelaunch` and properly populate environment variables, so `get_launch_parameters` doesn't return the proper WINEDLLOVERRIDES and the generated script is incomplete, not taking advantage of DXVK and other important DLLs that should be used.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install a game
2. Configure DXVK or some other runner option that's enabled via WINEDLLOVERRIDE
3. At a terminal run `lutris -b /tmp/game.sh lutris:write-script/1` or swap the `1` for the game ID of the game you installed.
4. `grep WINEDLLOVERRIDES /tmp/game.sh` and note the lack of overrides for the things configured in step 2


### Expected behavior

I expect the generated script to be able to adequately launch the game without Lutris, using the options I'd configured in Lutris. For example, when launching a copy of the same game from lutris, I see the following:

```
$ xargs -0 -n 1 echo < /proc/396196/environ | grep WINEDLLOVERRIDES
WINEDLLOVERRIDES=d3d10core,d3d11,d3d12,d3d9,d3dcompiler_42,d3dcompiler_43,d3dcompiler_46,d3dcompiler_47,d3dx10,d3dx10_33,d3dx10_34,d3dx10_35,d3dx10_36,d3dx10_37,d3dx10_38,d3dx10_39,d3dx10_40,d3dx10_41,d3dx10_42,d3dx10_43,d3dx11_42,d3dx11_43,d3dx9_24,d3dx9_25,d3dx9_26,d3dx9_27,d3dx9_28,d3dx9_29,d3dx9_30,d3dx9_31,d3dx9_32,d3dx9_33,d3dx9_34,d3dx9_35,d3dx9_36,d3dx9_37,d3dx9_38,d3dx9_39,d3dx9_40,d3dx9_41,d3dx9_42,d3dx9_43,dxgi=n;winemenubuilder=
```

### Log output

```shell
$ lutris -b /tmp/gw2.sh lutris:write-script/1

```

title: Zoom adjustment slider not updated with view type
body:
### Bug description

Lutris maintains two zoom settings- one for the list view type, and one for the grid view type. They are independent.

When you switch between these modes, the actual game view updates appropriately, but the zoom slider does not, so it contains a stale setting. This can interfere with changing the zoom.

### How to Reproduce

First, we must configure Lutris so that the two view modes disagree about the zoom. So start Lutris and switch to grid view; set it to  shows banners. Switch to list view, and set that to show icons. Now the disagree.

The zoom slider is still in the 'icon' (left) position. Switch to grid view; the grid displays *with banners*. But open the view menu; the slider is still the in 'icon' (left) position.

### Expected behavior

The slider should update to reflect the state of the view.

### Log output

title: Last played and Time played contents are overlapping
body:

The contents of the Time played and Last played section of the UI is overlapping for some reason. It is a small visual bug, but nonetheless a bug.




### How to Reproduce

title: Lutris-Git, newly added Source, "Ubisoft Connect" shows File Not Found after login
body:
### Bug description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45468984/151615243-0cb5fdbb-a2c9-421a-b196-29ea4c4b87d1.png)
The bug shows a file not found exception when logging into the newly added source "Ubisoft Connect".
It attempts to work with a file in a folder that hasn't been created yet "ubisoft-connect/..." (see screenshot exception file path

### How to Reproduce

This error occured the following way:
1. Run Lutris via Terminal 
2. Enable Ubisoft as a Source or if already enabled continue:
3. Click login and login with info. Click on disallow cookies because common sense.
4. Either the login window will remain white until you close it (first time, same with origin but fixed after trying Step 3 again) or the Window will disappear and now a cogwheel will appear next to the Ubisoft Source.
5. The cogwheel will spin forever and reclick Ubisoft Connect Source will show coverless / iconless games of your library.
6. Clicking on "Install" on any game does nothing. No window, no message nothing.
The error message suggests that the lutris written ubisoft.py file attempts to read or write to a file that doesn't exist.


### Expected behavior

Logging in to Ubisoft Connect and seeing the listed games with their covers (like the way it perfectly worked with Origin Source).

title: Can't login to origin.
body:
### Bug description

After origin's login page - there is empty webpage. It doesn't close it self and origin don't think there was any authentication (+ exceptions in log).
Also probably in log some sensitive information since it is authentication :)

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Click on Origin's login.
2. Login.
3. See empty page.
4. Wait and/or close it.

title: python module lxml needs to be mannualy installed on Gentoo gnu/linux
body:
### Bug description

I installed lutris with emerge

pretty much the title. When trying to double click on lutris icon nothing happens, when launching through the terminal it displays the log output that i pasted below. Problem is solved by typing
```
pip3 install lxml --user
```

1. Open terminal on Gentoo GNU/linux
2. Type lutris
3. issue

launch without a problem

title: On startup the game list is empty when side panel is deactivated
body:
### Bug description

When "Show Side Panel" is deactivated Game Library is not shown, changing layout or activating "Show Side Panel" shows the library contents





![1 Screenshot_2022-01-24_17-30-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89305232/150824077-8ab5b1b3-603f-4699-a06e-6a9da7ab0ece.png)

### How to Reproduce

I've tried:
* Starting Lutris with the game list in "tile" layout => list area stays empty, changing the layout renders the list.
* Starting Lutris with the game list in the "list" layout => list area stays empty, changing the layout renders the list.
* Starting Lutris with any game list layout => list is empty, activating "show side panel" makes the list appear.
* **Starting Lutris with any game list layout AND "show side panel" activated => game list appears on startup.**

In the lutris -d output it can be clearly seen: the message "Showing 17 games" only appears after the view type was changed.

![2 Screenshot_2022-01-24_17-30-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89305232/150824228-3e81e80c-8b01-402e-a218-4b942397d7a6.png)

### Expected behavior

When "show side panel" is deactivated game list should appear on startup.

![3 Screenshot_2022-01-24_17-31-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89305232/150824172-986606d6-82ac-47ca-b21a-9b46e1d0756d.png)

title: Duplicate configuration windows may be opened at once
body:
### Bug description

It is possible to open the same configuration editor twice, getting two windows to edit the same content.

This can be done with the game configuration and with the runner configuration.

### How to Reproduce

Enter Lutris, and right click a game and choose "Configure" a window opens.

Move this window aside. Right click the *same* game again, and chose "Configure". The window opens again. Now there are two!

You can do the same trick with the runner config in preferences (but not from the main window).

### Expected behavior

The game window should be brought to the front, not duplicated.

### Log output

title: Installing GOG game from GOG tab gives "Cannot retrieve game installer"
body:
### Bug description

When I try to install some GOG games from the GOG tab in Lutris, I get a popup saying "Cannot retrieve game installer". If I close the popup and choose to install with GOG, I get the default GOG installer, when there are specific ScummVM/GOG installers.
Installing from the Lutris->Community installers tab works, and I am able even to choose between different installers if there is more than one.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'GoG tab'
2. Select a game (eg Leisure Suit Larry 1)
3. Click on 'Install'
4. See 'Cannot Retrieve Installer' popup
5. Click OK. Select installer popup (usually in background)
6. Click on GOG (only choice)
7. View source - it is the default GOG installer


### Expected behavior

The installer is retrieved from the site. If more than one installer exists for that GOG game, the user is given the choice between them.

title: White flash occurs when switching between sidebar rows
body:
### Bug description

There's an unpleasant white flash that occurs when switching between sidebar rows. It doesn't really break anything, but it's not classy.

It's actually trying to accommodate a spinner that is sometimes displayed- it's useful to do this when searching Lutris, which can take seconds to complete. But it does it even when switching between ordinary sidebar rows, which is too fast for this to be useful.

### How to Reproduce

Run Lutris. Switch between rows; there's a brief flash as the game view is visibly removed then replaced just after.

### Expected behavior

I think it should update without this visual discontinuity - when possible. When searching Lutris.net, it can take several seconds to complete the search, so the white 'flash' is needed  or the spinner looks dumb.

### Log output

title: 32-bit Wineprefix breaks if wineconsole is used first
body:
### Bug description

If you manually add a Wine game to Lutris and explicitly set it as 32-bit prefix, then use the wineconsole menu option first, it will break the prefix as it assumes it is 64-bit.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Click + (add new game)
2. Add Wine runner game. Under game options, set Prefix architecture to 32-bit, set Wine prefix and working directory, click save
3. Select new game, click the Wine menu at the bottom and select Open Wine console
4. No functions will work in this prefix anymore as it assumes it is a 64-bit prefix


### Expected behavior

When adding a new game it should create the 32-bit prefix if the Open Wine console function is used first.

title: Libretro and Mednafen don't work with Lutris 5.9.1 on Linux Mint 20.3
body:
### Bug description

I have a NES game which doesn't start either with Mednafen or Libretro on Linux Mint 20.3. I can't start Libretro settings by clicking "Play" icon in Runners section in left sidebar. That wasn't the case on Pop!_OS 20.10. 

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install any NES game.
2. Select appriopriate runner from the list in the Config (either Libretro or Mednafen). and set up other necessary options.
3. Hit 'Play'
4. See game not being launched or don't see game being launched. It's up to you.


### Expected behavior

I would expect games to launch with either Mednafen or Libretro.

title: wget in Lutris script does not work on Fedora 35
body: ### Bug description Fedora 35, lutris-0.5.9.1-3.fc35.x86_64. It looks like that the wget used by Lutris scripts does not work. I get this error on stdout when trying to install [Re-Volt](https://lutris.net/games/re-volt/) native port: ``` wget: symbol lookup error: /lib64/libassuan.so.0: undefined symbol: gpgrt_malloc, version GPG_ERROR_1.0 The 'wget' command is missing! ``` It does not seem to be the actual Re-Volt native port install script issue since this script only runs this command (that seems to work fine when running outside of Lutris): `os.system("wget -O {} {} {}".format(filename, options["wget"], url))` ### How to Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Use latest Lutris from system repository on fully updated Fedora 35. 2. Try installing Re-Volt native port using this script: https://lutris.net/games/install/2198/view (or another game script that uses wget) 3. See the output log. ### Expected behavior wget runs correctly and downloads the game archive. ### Log output ```shell 2022-01-14 21:26:01,359: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1 2022-01-14 21:26:01,389: No cores found 2022-01-14 21:26:02,101: Startup complete INFO 2022-01-14 21:26:02,105 [startup.check_driver:61]:Running AMD Mesa driver 21.3.3 on AMD Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.42.0, 5.15.12-200.fc35.x86_64, LLVM 13.0.0) (0x67df) INFO 2022-01-14 21:26:02,106 [startup.check_driver:73]:GPU: 1002:67DF 1DA2:E366 (amdgpu drivers) DEBUG 2022-01-14 21:26:02,915 [lutriswindow.update_store:451]:Showing 3 games 2022-01-14 21:26:10,080: Running AMD Mesa driver 21.3.3 on AMD Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.42.0, 5.15.12-200.fc35.x86_64, LLVM 13.0.0) (0x67df) 2022-01-14 21:26:10,080: GPU: 1002:67DF 1DA2:E366 (amdgpu drivers) 2022-01-14 21:26:10,104: Fetching installer https://lutris.net/api/installers/re-volt-latest-rvgl 2022-01-14 21:26:10,104: GET https://lutris.net/api/installers/re-volt-latest-rvgl (lutris:36974): Gtk-WARNING **: 21:26:10.268: Failed to set text 'For multiplayer matches you might want to join the Re-Volt discord here: https://discord.gg/NMT4Xdb">https://discord.gg/NMT4Xdb' from markup due to error parsing markup: Chyba na řádku 1, znak 106: Nezapadající znak „/“, po názvu atributu „https:“ prvku „a“ bylo očekáváno „=“ (lutris:36974): Gtk-WARNING **: 21:26:10.270: Failed to set text 'For multiplayer matches you might want to join the Re-Volt discord here: https://discord.gg/NMT4Xdb">https://discord.gg/NMT4Xdb' from markup due to error parsing markup: Chyba na řádku 1, znak 106: Nezapadající znak „/“, po názvu atributu „https:“ prvku „a“ bylo očekáváno „=“ 2022-01-14 21:26:10,275: Showing window re-volt 2022-01-14 21:26:12,165: Retrieving current resolution 2022-01-14 21:26:13,478: Files are ready? title: Preferences window doesn't open when running on aarch64 (RPI4/400, Manjaro)
body:
### Bug description

Testing on a Pi400 running the latest Manjaro XFCE (aarch64).
I installed lutris using `pacman -S lutris`, which also installed the dependencies. I can start it up normally, but I cannot open the preferences window.

Starting it from the console showed some more details:
If I try to open the Prefs window, it crashes with the following piece of the traceback:
```
"/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/util/linux.py", line 449, in gather_system_info_str 
cpu_dict["Vendor"] = system_info["cpus"][0]["vendor_id"] 
KeyError: 'vendor_id'
```

As the author of Amiberry, I was looking at how I could integrate it to Lutris so it can launch Amiga games (I know FS-UAE is already available). I could set up a "Linux" game hardcoding the emulator path and parameters to a game, and it worked as expected, so it would be interesting to fully integrate the emulator the "proper" way.
But the prefs window problem is a bit of a blocker for now. :)

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Use a Raspberry Pi 4 or Pi400, running the latest Manjaro XCFE
2. Install lutris using `pacman`
3. Run lutris from the console to see the messages
4. Try to open the Preferences window


### Expected behavior

The aarch64 CPU should be detected and the application should function normally (Prefs window should open).

### Log output

title: Installation of a game requiring libretro (if that is not installed) hangs up
body:
### Bug description

The new code (not yet in a release) that installs libretro if it is not installed before installing a game bugs to and fails with an exception. It appears to be using super() in a context where that does not work.

The traceback for this is not in the log; it comes out on stderr, I think. It is:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/installer/interpreter.py", line 161, in launch_install
    self.install_runners()
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/installer/interpreter.py", line 239, in install_runners
    self.install_runner(self.runners_to_install.pop(0))
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/installer/interpreter.py", line 247, in install_runner
    runner.install(
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/runners/libretro.py", line 147, in install
    super().install(version=None, downloader=downloader, callback=install_core)
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/runners/runner.py", line 380, in install
    self.download_and_extract(runner["url"], **opts)
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/runners/runner.py", line 390, in download_and_extract

    callback()
  File "/home/danj/Projects/lutris/lutris/runners/libretro.py", line 144, in install_core
    super().install(version, downloader, callback)
RuntimeError: super(): no arguments

### How to Reproduce

Get the latest Lutris from the repo; the most recent release does not have this bug.

Uninstall libretro, if installed. We need it to install before the game. But do pre-install the PPSSPP runner.

Go to the Lutris service, and select "Steins;gate" from the community installers. Try to install it; don't worry you won't need the ROM. You won't get that far.

Try to install it. It will download and install libretro as expected, but then it hangs up and the install does not continue. It is asked where to install the game, but there's no button to accept the directory. See media below.

### Expected behavior

The install should continue normally after libretro was installed.

title: Lutris cannot find a submited file on `file:N/A` if it has brackets on its name
body:
### Bug description

While using `file: N/A:Please select the .zip archive.`, if the supplied file has a name that contains brackets, that is, the characters `[` and `]`, it will fail saying the file "does not exist", even if it does exist.

If before doing it, the filename is renamed and the brackets are removed, then it works fine. 

If the file is cached, then it is cached with the filename with brackets, and it will be necessary to rename the file inside the cache dir to remove the brackets, or completely delete it from the cache. Otherwise it will still complain that the file does not exist.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. On any installer that request the user for a file, submit a file that contains brackets on its name.
Something like `Game [English].zip`.

That will fail.

### Expected behavior

Having brackets in the filename should not break an installation.

### Log output

title: Fix directories for fsuae runner
body:
### Bug description

Some runner can be installed, but can't be removed. Trying to do so just does nothing.

FS-UAE and EasyRPG are examples.

### How to Reproduce

Go into Lutris Preferences. Install FS-UAE; then click the remove button.

It asks if you really want to. Say yes.

And... nothing happens.

### Expected behavior

This should remove the runner; it should delete its directory, and it should disappear from the sidebar of the main window.

title: Incorrect error message when executable is set but missing
body:
### Bug description

Lutris gives the "no executable set" error when it is set, but is missing. There is code for a better message, but bugs in the runner prevent it from being seen.

### How to Reproduce

Find a WINE game and rename its specified executable.

Try to run the game in Lutris. The error "This game has no executable set..." appears.

### Expected behavior

I expect an error saying that the file was not found- and tell me which file.

title: Unable to log into GOG
body:
### Bug description

Logging into GOG is impossible, as the login window is blank.

### How to Reproduce

1. Run `lutris`
2. Click on the login button on the "GOG" entry in the sidebar.
3. A blank window comes up.

### Expected behavior

I expected to get a login prompt of some form, similar to the Humble Bundle login prompt, which is working for me.

title: Wine default runner ignored for installation
body:
### Bug description

Lutris honours the selection of wine runner when running a game, however, for installation, it always uses the latest Lutris provided wine runner.
I have this issue and have seen reports in the forums that ar at least one year old with it: [Select default wine version for installation](https://forums.lutris.net/t/select-default-wine-version-for-installation/11294/15)
I found out this issue as I was trying to install some GOG and Humble Bundle games. The games would install properly when I used the system Wine with the WINEPREFIX and command line options from the (failed) Lutris install logs. However, it doesn't matter which Wine runner is chosen, Lutris always uses the latest Lutris Wine (wine-lutris-fshack-6.21-6-x86_64 at this moment) for the installation.
Could be related to #2126 and/or #1814 

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the runners sidebar
2. Click on Configure in front of Wine
3. Select a system wine version. Save
4. Try to install a GoG or Humble Bundle Win32 game (I tried Day of the Tentacle, Settlers IV, The Witcher; Enhanced Edition, Psychonauts 2)
5. Check the logs to see which wine version was used


### Expected behavior

The selected Wine runner should be used for installation

### Log output

title: Failed to execute process after 5.9.1 update
body:
### Bug description

Hello everyone! Ever since lutris updates from 5.8.4 to 5.9.1, I haven’t been able to launch anything from the Lutris launcher, getting this following error:

[Failed to execute process. Check that the file exists.](https://paste.opensuse.org/3e738a7c)
This happens for every application I try to launch, even on native linux applications (Tacoma), all of them saying they can’t find the executable and then crashing.
([Extra log](https://paste.opensuse.org/24ebb9d3) containing me trying to launch 3 wine games, 1 steam game and 1 native linux game) 

This is my Lutris issue report: [Link](https://paste.opensuse.org/7a1d90c5)

Other things tried: Compiling lutris myself, compiling the git version of lutris.

When I use the option "Run EXE from inside prefix" and select the exe for my game of choice (in this case, a patcher to update the game), the patcher can't write to the file right next to it, making me wonder if it can't see it.

When I use the option to run a bash terminal, I can cd into the folder and "wine patcher.exe" without any problems and everything works fine.

### How to Reproduce

1. Open Lutris (Version 5.9.1)
2. Launch any game, no matter the runtime
3. The play button in lutris changes momentarily before changing back to play, as it couldn't launch the game

### Expected behavior

Games launching properly as they did a version prior.

title: Cannot update Steam library
body:
### Bug description

Cannot update steam library, get small window with text 'appid'.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Main page
2. Click on Reload near Steam
3. See window with text 'appid'


### Expected behavior

Steam library should be updated without issues.

### Log output

```shell

title: Newly added Lutris games do not download their banners
body:
### Bug description

Lutris's banner and icon download is full of holes; it tries to download banners and icons when adding games or searching, but its spotty and games are easily introduced with no banner. They just come out at grey boxes.  

This could be considered a dupe of #3458, but I've got a repro for you. It's not just "I'd like a better architecture"- the current approach fails in some cases. Not just obscure cases either. Read on!

### How to Reproduce

First, go to Lutris.net and sign it, pick a game with a banner that you don't have, and add it to your library.

Now, open Lutris, and click the reload button on the Lutris sidebar row. Wait for it to complete.

Now, view the Lutris games and search for your new game. Don't forget to show non-installed games.

Your new game should appear, but it has no banner.

### Expected behavior

The banner should appear on the newly added game.

I had hoped for Lutris to download the banners for games that need them if missing, no matter how you add the game.

### Log output

```shell
INFO     2021-12-29 10:10:48,924 [startup.check_driver:53]:Using NVIDIA drivers 470.86 for x86_64
INFO     2021-12-29 10:10:48,924 [startup.check_driver:57]:GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060
INFO     2021-12-29 10:10:48,924 [startup.check_driver:73]:GPU: 10DE:2503 196E:1377 (nvidia drivers)
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:49,110 [lutriswindow.update_store:451]:Showing 184 games
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:51,240 [base.wipe_game_cache:265]:Deleting lutris cache /home/danj/.cache/lutris/lutris
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:51,240 [base.wipe_game_cache:113]:Deleting games from service-games for lutris
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:51,259 [http.get:81]:GET https://lutris.net/api/games/library/danieljohnson2
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:54,195 [lutris.load:108]:Matching with already installed games
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:54,466 [lutris.load:111]:Lutris games loaded
DEBUG    2021-12-29 10:10:54,472 [lutriswindow.update_store:451]:Showing 185 games
INFO     2021-12-29 10:10:58,466 [application.do_shutdown:631]:Shutting down Lutris
```


### System Information

title: After pushing the add-game button, it stays pressed
body:
### Bug description

After you use the add-games button, the button stays in the pressed visual state (though it still *works* actually).

### How to Reproduce

Start Lutris. Click the add-game button in the upper left corner. Cancel the add-game dialog.

Behold the button. It is all pressed.

### Expected behavior

The button should reset to its original visual state.

title: Turn off monitors except - not working in Wayland (GNOME)

labels.name: PR friendly
labels.description: Good issues to start contributing to lutris

body:
### Bug description

The option to turn off secondary monitor is not working in GNOME Wayland. It does work in GNOME Xorg mode.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to game configuration -> System options.
2. Check "Show advanced options".
3. Scroll down to "Turn off monitors except" options and choose "Primary".
4. Run the game.

### Expected behavior

Secondary monitor turns off.

title: Sidebar running icons don't fallback to the 'package' icon
body:
### Bug description

While runners in the preferences dialog fall back to a 'package' icon if they have no icon, the runners in the side bar do not- you get the generic broken image icon instead.

### How to Reproduce

Install the MicroM8 runner; when you do you'll see the preferences shows a generic package icon for it.

Now check out the sidebar. Not the same icon!

### Expected behavior

I think the same icon should be shown in the sidebar as in the preferences.

title: Installing from Lutris can fail silently
body:
### Bug description

Some Lutris games can't be installed, but give no error- Install just does nothing.

This seems to happen for games with no installation scripts. The example I have is "Attack of the Earthlings"- that is on Lutris as "https://lutris.net/games/attack-of-the-earthlings/", but somehow the search can't seem to find it. Lutris has no scripts for this.

### How to Reproduce

Open Lutris and go to the "Lutris" section. Select "Attack of the Earthlings"; an "Install" button will appear in the game box. Click it.

Nothing happens.

There's a catch though; if you've installed it once it'll be in the PGA, and then it will know to install it the same way as before. You have to install something that's not in the PGA, I think.

### Expected behavior

I expect an error message in this case.

I see the debug output in the log, "Wait? how did you get here?". Attack of the Earthlings, that's how.

### Log output

title: Modal dialogs aren't really modal
body:
### Bug description

Lutris has some windows, like game configuration, that seem like they should be modal and others that aren't (like the installer window). They are different- an installer window does not prevent you from accessing the Lutris window again. Just click it and it comes to the front.

But other dialogs do prevent you from bringing the main window to the front. This makes sense- you probably shouldn't be using the main window while reconfiguring its content, and unlike installation the configuration isn't something that you'd do in the background.

The preferences window is the same way.

The thing is, you can still activate the main Lutris window (see media) and interact with it, but it won't come to the front. There also may be some special visual effects for modal dialog (GNOME does this by default- they call it "attached dialogs". It's a bit like OS X this way).

See also issue #3466, which is about the way these half-modal dialogs interact with the about box, which is a proper modal dialog.

### How to Reproduce

Open Lutris. Select any game and use the configure command; a dialog appears. Now, click on the Lutris window hiding behind it. It activates, but it does not come to the front.

The configuration dialog is rather big and really gets in the way of using the main window. This kind of 'inactive, always in front' behavior can work for small windows, but I don't buy it here.

### Expected behavior

Either we should be able to bring Lutris to the front (as with installer windows) or the dialogs should be proper modal dialogs.


### Log output

```shell

title: Preferences dialog content is too wide for the dialog
body:
### Bug description

The actual content of the preferences dialog is unreasonably wide, and requires horizontal scrolling in the preferences window, at its default size.

I think the basic problem is that several labels need to word wrap so they don't "prop the window open" as it were.

### How to Reproduce

Open the preferences dialog and select the "Runners" section.

Try to click on any of the install or remove buttons. You can't! They are off screen to the right; you have to scroll.

### Expected behavior

The content of the preferences dialog should not be so wide- it is mostly whitespace.

title: Runners can be configured when not yet installed, but not after removal
body:
### Bug description

When you go into the Preferences dialog, Runners section, all the runners may be configured even if not installed. But  if you remove one, it's configure button disappears.

### How to Reproduce

Go into Preferences, select "Runners". Now, pick a runner and remove it. The configure button for that runner will disappear.

I think that is correct- but notice that all the other uninstalled runners have configure buttons. See the media attached. That can't be right.

### Expected behavior

I expect that the configure button will appear only for installed runners in the first place.

### Log output

title: When a new runner is installed, the sidebar may be corrupted
body:
### Bug description

Installing a runner may leave the sidebar in a corrupted state, with misplaced headers. Restarting Lutris corrects this.

What is happening, I think, is that the header_func that sets up the headers does not *remove* the header row from rows that are no longer at the top of the section- so the same header is attached to two rows. This seems to draw the header in one slot, and leave the other slot blank.

This header_func needs to remove the header from where it does not belong, not just add it where it does belong.

### How to Reproduce

Go into Preferences and install "Citra"- I expect other runners could do this. Once it has installed, observe that sidebar shows a gap in it. See attached media. The "Runners" header is below the new runner, not above it, and a blank space is above it.

I pick "Citra" because it will appear above all other runners, due to alphabetical order. I think it needs to be the new first runner.

### Expected behavior

I expect the "Runners" header to move above "Citra" here, and disappear from where it was.

title: Low contrast text in sidebar during mouse hover
body:
### Bug description

So, I've been trying out gnome-session for that Fedora vibe- the latest Pop!_OS supports it reasonable well- but Lutris has a problem. When you hover over the selected sidebar row, it is hard to read due to the low contrast of the text.

This is because- for some reason- Lutris uses light grey as its hover background color, but GNOME by default would use a dark blue background and white text. It really should not be overriding the background without also overriding the text color to woirk with it.

### How to Reproduce

Install gnome-session and use it. Or I guess you could install Fedora.

Start Lutris; point the mouse at the currently selected row.

Try to read it.

### Expected behavior

The text and background should be in contrasting colors.

### Log output

```shell

title: Clicking cancel when moving the install directory still moves it
body:
### Bug description

Clicking cancel when moving the install directory still moves it.

This is really annoying when you accidentally click somewhere, or accidentally choose your download folder etc.
Once moved my entire desktop into my downloads folder because of this.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any game
2. Click on configure
3. Under Game Info -> Directory click move
4. click anywhere that isnt the original location
5. Click cancel
6. See that the folder still moved to that location

### Expected behavior

When clicking cancel it should cancel the action and not move anything

### Log output

title: Lutris will delete game folder when instructed not to
body:
### Bug description

When doing an install (Cyberpunk 2077, GOG galaxy, in my case), if the installation is interrupted, Lutris will delete the game folder for said installation, even when you uncheck the checkbox for deleting game files.

It should be possible to resume an install or, at the very least, stop Lutris from deleting the entire Wine directory when canceling an install, so that you can recover downloads that are not put in the cache (downloads done by Wine applications, as part of the install, for example).

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Install Cyberpunk 2077 (GOG Galaxy) and cancel the install if/when it fails and the games folder will be deleted, even though you uncheck the option to delete the games folder

### Expected behavior

When unchecking the option for deleting the game's files, when canceling an installation, the application should leave the Wine folder intact

### Log output

```shell
2021-12-17 17:21:09,188: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-12-17 17:21:09,259: No cores found
2021-12-17 17:21:11,129: Startup complete
INFO     2021-12-17 17:21:11,131 [startup.check_driver:61]:Running AMD Mesa driver 21.2.2 on AMD Radeon(TM) Vega 8 Graphics (RAVEN, DRM 3.41.0, 5.13.0-22-generic, LLVM 12.0.1) (0x15d8)

title: Version 0.5.9.1 CLI is broken.
body:
### Bug description

I am using Gentoo Linux (multilib profile), and I am using Python 3.9.9. I have recently installed Lutris, and I get the following error when using the '-s' flag to list my Steam games.
```
jamie@TuxBox ~ $ lutris -s
2021-12-15 19:04:59,704: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-12-15 19:04:59,832: No cores found
2021-12-15 19:05:02,350: Startup complete
2021-12-15 19:05:02,353: Using NVIDIA drivers 495.44 for x86_64
2021-12-15 19:05:02,353: GPU: Unknown
2021-12-15 19:05:02,354: GPU: 10DE:13C2 10DE:1116 (nvidia drivers)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 348, in do_command_line
    self.print_steam_list(command_line)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 598, in print_steam_list
    for path in steamapps_paths[platform]:
TypeError: 'dict_values' object is not subscriptable
2021-12-15 19:05:02,455: Shutting down Lutris
jamie@TuxBox ~ $
```

This also occurs for the --list-steam-folders option:
```
jamie@TuxBox ~ $ lutris --list-steam-folders
2021-12-15 19:09:41,515: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-12-15 19:09:41,643: No cores found
2021-12-15 19:09:43,463: Failed to read content length on response from https://api.github.com/repos/lutris/dxvk/releases
2021-12-15 19:09:43,966: Failed to read content length on response from https://api.github.com/repos/lutris/dxvk-nvapi/releases
2021-12-15 19:09:44,457: Failed to read content length on response from https://api.github.com/repos/lutris/vkd3d/releases
2021-12-15 19:09:44,952: Startup complete
2021-12-15 19:09:44,955: Using NVIDIA drivers 495.44 for x86_64
2021-12-15 19:09:44,956: GPU: Unknown
2021-12-15 19:09:44,957: GPU: 10DE:13C2 10DE:1116 (nvidia drivers)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 352, in do_command_line
    self.print_steam_folders(command_line)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 627, in print_steam_folders
    for path in steamapps_paths[platform]:
TypeError: 'dict_values' object is not subscriptable
2021-12-15 19:09:45,056: Shutting down Lutris
jamie@TuxBox ~ $
```

And the '-o' option just boots me into Lutris:
```
jamie@TuxBox ~ $ lutris -o
2021-12-15 19:11:16,467: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-12-15 19:11:16,596: No cores found
2021-12-15 19:11:18,855: Startup complete
2021-12-15 19:11:18,858: Using NVIDIA drivers 495.44 for x86_64
2021-12-15 19:11:18,859: GPU: Unknown
2021-12-15 19:11:18,860: GPU: 10DE:13C2 10DE:1116 (nvidia drivers)
2021-12-15 19:11:20,776: Unable to load icon from image /home/jamie/.cache/lutris/steam/banners/2064-read-only-memories.jpg
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/lutriswindow.py", line 455, in update_store
    self.game_store.add_game(game)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/views/store.py", line 158, in add_game
    game.get_pixbuf(),
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/views/store_item.py", line 107, in get_pixbuf
    return get_pixbuf(image_path, self.service_media.size, is_installed=self.installed)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/gui/widgets/utils.py", line 62, in get_pixbuf
    pixbuf.composite(
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'composite'

```

-l seems to be fine though
```
amie@TuxBox ~ $ lutris -l
2021-12-15 19:13:43,672: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-12-15 19:13:43,799: No cores found
2021-12-15 19:13:46,043: Startup complete

2021-12-15 19:13:46,136: Shutting down Lutris
jamie@TuxBox ~ $
```

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Execute the command _lutris -s_ or _lutris --list-steam-folders_ or _lutris -o_


### Expected behavior

The CLI commands should perform as they are described in _lutris -h_

### Log output

```shell
jamie@TuxBox ~ $ lutris -d
2021-12-15 19:14:27,447: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1

title: Runner `lutris-6.21-6` has broken wineboot
body:
### Bug description

Installing Final Fantasy XIV with the lutris runner 6.21-6 does not work (it hangs on the first step, "Creating Wine prefix..."), wineboot seems to hang for 5 minutes until it times out.

The prefix is being created without an issue on `lutris-6.10-7`.

### How to Reproduce

title: Lutris "Vulkan ICD loader" auto settings defaults to Intel with optimus-manager
body:
### Bug description

I'm using [Optimus Manager](https://github.com/Askannz/optimus-manager) on ArchLinux to switch between Intel and Nvidia GPU for my laptop usage at home with dual-screen or on the go.

When in Nvidia mode, if I have "Vulkan ICD loader" setting to auto, diverse launchers work well but once I start a game, they crash. Once forcing it to Nvidia, it works as intended.

When Optimus is in Hybrid mode and the ICD setting to auto, games start on the Intel GPU.

All other settings are default ones (even NVIDIA Prime Render Offload is enabled).

What I think is that Lutris see both GPU (CLI logs seem to point at it) and "auto" then chooses Intel. But Optimus in Nvidia mode unloads all Intel modules, and thus it crashes.

Interesting errors can be found around L217 of the logs I pasted

Thanks you!

### How to Reproduce

* Use Optimus Manager to switch to Nvidia mode, use default settings and see games crashing
* Switch to Hybrid mode, default settings, see the Intel GPU used
* Force Vulkan ICD loader to Nvidia, see games working and using the dGPU

### Expected behavior

Maybe detect that Intel is unavailable in Nvidia mode and makes the "auto" setting be Nvidia. In Hybrid mode I don't know what the best flow would be.

title: Handle HTTP 403 errors
body:
I'm not sure why Lutris.net was 403-ing this user from our Discord server but the error should be handled:
```
2021-12-07 21:02:05,630: Magic not available. Unable to automatically find game executables. Please install python-magic
2021-12-07 21:02:05,684: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-12-07 21:02:05,712: No cores found

title: Can't stop Game using AppID
body:
### Bug description

Hi there,

I'm trying to play some games that I have on my Windows partition.
When I add the games to the library and start them it starts showing this line trough the terminal:

`2021-12-07 01:11:14,749: Data path for SteamApp *STEAM APPID* not found.`

I can exit the game but the Stop button doesn't change.



Thanks in advance.


### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add Custom Game
2. Set runner to Steam, add the app ID and the excecutable path and turn DRM Free On.
3. Start.
4. Stop from game, Lutris don't switch to start again.


### Expected behavior

The problem is solved when I delete the Application ID, but I feel like it should be a warning or a workaround instead of freezing.

### Log output

```shell
When it starts:

INFO     2021-12-07 01:18:49,518 [steam.get_game_path_from_appid:215]:Data path for SteamApp 1145360 not found.


When I try to stop it from lutris:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/game_actions.py", line 144, in on_game_stop
    game.force_stop()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/lutris/game.py", line 527, in force_stop
    os.kill(int(pid), signal.SIGTERM)
PermissionError: [Errno 1] Operation not permitted
```


### System Information

```shell
[System]
OS:              Manjaro Linux 21.2.0 Qonos
Arch:            x86_64
Kernel:          5.15.2-2-MANJARO
Desktop:         KDE
Display Server:  x11

[CPU]
Vendor:          AuthenticAMD
Model:           AMD Ryzen 7 5800X 8-Core Processor
Physical cores:  8
Logical cores:   16

[Memory]
RAM:             31.3 GB
Swap:            0.0 GB

[Graphics]
Vendor:          NVIDIA Corporation
OpenGL Renderer: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090/PCIe/SSE2
OpenGL Version:  4.6.0 NVIDIA 495.44
OpenGL Core:     4.6.0 NVIDIA 495.44
OpenGL ES:       OpenGL ES 3.2 NVIDIA 495.44
Vulkan:          Supported
```


### Media (optional)

_No response_

### Checklist:

- [X] I'm not asking for support with a game or the wine runner.
- [X] I have followed the above mentioned guides and have all the graphics and wine dependencies installed.
- [X] I have checked for existing issues that describe my problem prior to opening this one.
- [X] I understand that improperly formatted bug reports may be closed without explanation.

title: Can't install a GOG game that is not in the account's library if logged into GOG
body:
If I'm logged into GOG source and try to install a game that is not in my library (for testing for example), the installation will bork out with an empty error window and refuse to proceed. In the logs, i see this:
```
2021-12-03 18:53:13,076: Failed to request https://api.gog.com/products/1260828108/downlink/installer/en1installer0, check your GOG credentials and internet connectivity
2021-12-03 18:53:13,077: 
None
```
If I log out, everything works normally.

title: Lutris generates excessive errors during running PID check
body:
### Bug description


Lutris is generating a significant amount of errors during a check for other running processes.
The errors are ignorable, but there can be a lot of them.

The errors (with unprintable characters removed) look like:
```
[ERROR:2021-11-27 02:09:02,996:process]: Failed to parse environment variables: run/user/1000/klauncherZwwShY.1.slave-socket local:/run/user/1000/dolphinlXOpxH.225.slave-socket
```

The errors spawn from here:
https://github.com/lutris/lutris/blob/master/lutris/util/process.py#L119

--- What's going wrong
Lutris will periodically iterate through every process ID that has been created since launch.
For each process ID, It reads `/proc/<PID>/environ` in order to get information about the process.
If this data can not be parsed, an Error is thrown, and I've been seeing this a lot under certain circumstances.

I'm using kubuntu, and I use dolphin as a file browser.
Some applications launched from dolphin open up using kdeinit5 and a socket, which creates a new process with it's own PID.
The environ data of these processes is not standard format, for reasons I don't understand, and Lutris throws an Exception every time it fails to parse it.


### How to Reproduce

To reproduce, I double clicked a txt file in `dolphin` file browser which opened in `kate` text editor.

My xsession logs show that `kdeinit5` was called
```
kdeinit5: Got EXEC_NEW '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/plugins/kf5/kio/file.so' from launcher.
```

Looking through `ps aux`, I found that it had generated PID 80767.
```
> ps aux | grep 80767
mimorox    80767  0.0  0.1 108136 16460 ?        S    22:25   0:00 file.so [kdeinit5] file local:/run/user/1000/klauncherZwwShY.1.slave-socket local:/run/user/1000/dolphinAIzxFM.176.slave-socket
```

Taking a look at the environ data we see:
```
> cat /proc/80767/environ
run/user/1000/klauncherZwwShY.1.slave-socket local:/run/user/1000/dolphinAIzxFM.176.slave-socket1
```
Which is not correctly formatted, but matches the data in the error I've been seeing, and explains why the Exceptions are being generated.

This happens for a lot of processes launched from dolphin. VLC is an especially noisy one.

### Expected behavior

Lutris shouldn't log this many errors for something that can just be ignored silently.

Maybe there is something about the process that could indicate it won't have valid environ data and can be skipped. Perhaps any process with 'kdeinit5' on the `cmdline`?

This is kinda a broader issue, but the PID checks are very frequent, especially after closing a game. Maybe that could be adjusted to happen less often too?

### Log output

title: Null Play Time Causes Lutris to Crash Upon Using "lutris -lj"
body:
### Bug description

If there is a game that has no play time tracking (in my case Civ 6 installed from steam - native linux build) and you try running "lutris -lj" or "lutris --list-games --json", lutris will crash immediately.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Have a game installed from steam's native linux package
2. Run said game from lutris to make sure play time isnt being tracked
3. Run "lutris -lj" in a console

### Expected behavior

Lutris spits out the games list in json format

### Log output

```shell
$ lutris --list-games --json

2021-11-29 13:49:26,042: No cores found

2021-11-29 13:49:26,577: GPU: 1002:687F 148C:2387 (amdgpu drivers)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 342, in do_command_line
    self.print_game_json(command_line, game_list)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 580, in print_game_json
    games = [
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 588, in <listcomp>
    "playtime": str(timedelta(hours=game["playtime"])),
TypeError: unsupported type for timedelta hours component: NoneType
2021-11-29 13:49:26,649: Shutting down Lutris
```

title: Lutris unmet dependancy out of nowhere
body:
### Bug description

So i have been running lutris fine with a few games installed for about 2 weeks now on arch (endeavour technically) and out of nowhere today i tried upgrading my system by issuing the command Sudo pacman -Syu 

It returned me with this error 
: Synchronizing package databases...
 core is up to date
 extra is up to date
 community is up to date
 multilib is up to date
 endeavouros is up to date
 home_ungoogled_chromium_Arch is up to date
:: Starting full system upgrade...
resolving dependencies...
warning: cannot resolve "mesa-utils", a dependency of "lutris"
:: The following package cannot be upgraded due to unresolvable dependencies:
      lutris

:: Do you want to skip the above package for this upgrade? [y/N] 



I have tried installing the package by doing sudo pacman -S mesa-utils and a few other ones (not sure if that is right at all as im still very new to it) but i cannot seem to find anyone else with this issue, or how to fix it.







### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce this behavior:
unsure if you can replicate it but just trying to upgrade lutris through the terminal gave me this issue. 


### Expected behavior

I expected to be able to update the package with out this error of dependency not being met.

### Log output

title: "Running" tab is not refreshed when a game stops/starts
body:
If you stop a game that is listed in the running tab, it will not disappear from it, this will only happen if you switch to a different one and back.
Similar thing happens when a game starts through an application/desktop shortcut, the game is running but it's not listed because the view is not refreshed.
![Peek 2021-11-28 22-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10602045/143782556-aed44254-86de-4978-8227-41bacc8ff02c.gif)
![Screenshot from 2021-11-28 22-12-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10602045/143782562-4dece53f-284c-473f-ba36-a493138dc237.png)

title: Unable to browse GOG games
body:
### Bug description

I am unable to browse games from connected GOG account.
The login seems to went fine but no games are shown.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Sidebar'
2. Click on 'GOG'
3. Do 'Switch to terminal from witch Lutris was started'

title: Do not stop installation if the installation encounters an error
body:
How to reproduce:
1) Install Freelancer (https://lutris.net/games/freelancer/), the CD-ROM installer

Lutris will stop installation after the installer finishes because one of the wine components encountered a non-critical crash, yet it signaled the error (256) to Lutris, which chose to get stuck on the installation step instead of just continuing.

title: $GAMEDIR is set to None (Regression?)
body:
### Bug description

winesteam game installers like https://lutris.net/games/install/9593/view fail because variable $GAMEDIR is not changed to the "Absolute path where the game is installed." as written in documentation (https://github.com/lutris/lutris/blob/master/docs/installers.rst).

Found several old bugs related to this:
- https://github.com/lutris/lutris/issues/3449 : Closed without any reason.
- https://github.com/lutris/lutris/issues/805 : Replaced by #680 
- https://github.com/lutris/lutris/issues/680 : Closed because "ticket is a mess"

Log shows that $GAMEDIR is replaced by None, which causes wine to create a new empty prefix on the home directory, which then causes install to fail.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://lutris.net/games'
2. Search for some windows steam game like https://lutris.net/games/assassins-creed-origins/
3. Click on install and select steam option.
4. Lutris will show the install dialog, and fail with return code: 256


### Expected behavior

$GAMEDIR should be replaced with the winesteam prefix and Game should be installed.

### Log output

title: Install button from steam for windows (winesteam) does nothing.
body:
### Bug description

Trying to install a game with the install button from the steam for windows panel doesn't work.

Log says there's an error on steamwindows.py, `UnboundLocalError: local variable 'appid' referenced before assignment`

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Sources -> Steam for windows'
2. Click on 'reload button, wait for game list/icons to load.'
3. Click on any game and the Install button
4. See nothing.


### Expected behavior

Install dialog should appear.

title: "Could not retrieve game installer" when trying to install a game from EGS source
body: Whenever I try to install a game through the Epic Games source, I always get a "Could not retrieve game installer" when the installer window pops up. After I close it (which seems to put the installer window to foreground for some reason, very annoying), I can install EGS just fine.

title: GOG game file downloads stop
body:
### Bug description

Lutris download halts when a network error is encountered, thus making it impossible to install some games via the lutris installers.  

The issue is mostly encountered when downloading large files, due to them taking longer to download. As a result the chances of a random network error happening and interrupting the process is very likely. When this happens no error message is shown and the only symptom is that the network speed is displayed as 0 MB/s.
I confirmed that lutris stops downloading and this isn't just an output bug by checking network usage in nethogs witch stopped showing network activity for /usr/bin/python when the issue arose.

Possible solution: set timeout for download and retry to download chunk after timeout

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Sources/GOG'
2. Click on 'A game with large files (eg.: Cyberpunk 2077) install'
3. Do 'start installing the game'
4. See 'download stops'


### Expected behavior

Try/retry to continue download when network experiences momentary interruption.

title: 16k dbus-launch instances
body:
### Bug description

Basically when i open a game in lutris automatically it create a thousand instances of dbus-launch 

### How to Reproduce

install gamemode and run a game

### Expected behavior

i think lutris for some reason just open it again and again with no logic at all.
so after thinking for a while a friend told me about gamemode, it tourns out that if you dont have systemd and you dont configure it properly gamemode creates an infinite loop that fills up your ram so if someone is having this issue just uninstall gamemode

title: Epic Game Store Service not displaying all games
body:
### Bug description

I noticed battlefront 2 is not displaying in my library and is the only game missing. After some investigation it appears when using the library-service API https://library-service.live.use1a.on.epicgames.com/library/api/public/items?includeMetadata=true.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Epic Game Store Service'
2. Click on 'Refresh Library'
3. Do 'authentication'
4. See 'observe Battlefront 2 is not displayed in lutris but visible in epic game store'


### Expected behavior

All games in the EGS Library should be available in lutris

title: Client hang/crash when testing Morrowind openmw installer
body:
### Bug description

Tried to update Morrowind + OpenMW installer for GOG to 0.47. When running the 0.46 installer it works fine, but if I edit the script just changing a single line (the path to the openmw download) just editing a single character (changing the 6 in 46 to a 7) it causes a crash. Visually I see a window asking me to press a continue button that isn't there.

was told to file a bug here, and that it still applied even though it's technically based around and installer, they said the client is crashing so to still submit it.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to morrowind GOTY installer and edit it
2. edit line 2 to point to the .47 download (https://downloads.openmw.org/linux/generic/openmw-0.47.0-Linux-64Bit.tar.gz)
3. Save the draft
4. click "test this installer" and see the crash.

### Expected behavior

that morrowind+openmw .47 is installed

title: Lutris doesn't download DXVK versions other than the latest
body:
### Bug description

When you switch DXVK version in the game configuration to an older version (to check if an issue the user is experiencing is a regression, for instance), DXVK doesn't actually download the older version. Instead, it keeps using the latest version that Lutris downloaded on startup.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Keep Lutris open the whole time
1. Open the game's configuration
2. Add an environment variable `DXVK_HUD` with the value `version, save and close configuration.
3. Launch the game or a test app with DXVK enabled
4. Note the DXVK version displayed in the upper left corner
5. Stop the game
6. Switch DXVK version to an older one (for instance, 1.8.1L), save and close configuration.
7. Launch the app/game again with DXVK enabled
8. See that the DXVK version in the HUD doesn't match the one that was set in configuration


### Expected behavior

Lutris needs to download the older version on game startup. It previously did so but that changed in some version.

### Log output

title: Lutris crashes when trying to connect to GOG on Wayland 1.1.9
body:
### Bug description

Lutris crashes abruptly when I click the person icon to connect to GOG. Running lutris from the CLI shows that it crashes with a SIGABRT. This seems to originate from egl-wayland.


### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start lutris
2. Click on the person icon next to GOG on the sidebar.
3. See lutris crash immediately.


### Expected behavior

Lutris initiates connection to GOG.

### Log output

```shell
2021-11-18 11:41:43,252: Starting Lutris 0.5.9.1
2021-11-18 11:41:43,281: No cores found

title: Banners and icons aren't displayed in configuration
body:
### Bug description

Even though the icon for game exists and is used for desktop shortcuts, and the banner does show up in the library, Lutris does not display them in game configuration menu, in the Game Info tab, instead showing default blanks.

### How to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open configuration for a game that has a linked icon the website and a banner
2. Open the Game Info tab
3. See the issue (screenshot attached below)

### Expected behavior

Lutris should display the banner and the icon in the configuration.

### Log output

title: DllManager only updates WINEDLLOVERRIDES overrides on client restart
body:
How to reproduce:
1) Launch Lutris in the debug mode (lutris -d in terminal)
2) Launch a game with the DXVK option enabled. WINEDLLOVERRIDES environment variable (printed in the output) shows that overrides like d3d11, d3d9, d3d10core are set.
3) Go to the game's configuration, disable DXVK. Do not close Lutris after this
4) Launch it again. WINEDLLOVERRIDES environment variable will still have overrides like d3d11, d3d9, d3d10core set to `=n`.
5) Close Lutris, restart it again (still in debug mode)
6) Launch the same game that had DXVK disabled. WINEDLLOVERRIDES will not have d3d11, d3d9, d3d10core overrides set.

This happens with all DllManager operated versions.

title: TreeModelFilter.refilter should take into consideration the fact that the view is empty
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you are selecting a runner that doesn't have any visible entry, you'll get a number of GTK errors on your terminal output.

```
(lutris:320775): Gtk-CRITICAL **: 01:11:08.108: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_iter_to_child_iter: assertion 'valid == TRUE' failed                                                                                                                      
(lutris:320775): Gtk-CRITICAL **: 01:11:08.108: gtk_tree_model_filter_real_unref_node: assertion 'filter->priv->stamp == iter->stamp' failed                                                                                                          
(lutris:320775): Gtk-CRITICAL **: 01:11:08.108: gtk_tree_model_sort_real_unref_node: assertion 'elt->ref_count > 0' failed
```
The error messages are caused by calling refilter on a runner with no elements if the previous runner had at least 1 element displayed:
```
lutris/gui/lutriswindow.py:696:        self.game_store.modelfilter.refilter()
lutris/gui/lutriswindow.py:711:        self.game_store.modelfilter.refilter()
```

**Expected behavior**
There shouldn't be any errors when selecting a runner that doesn't have any entries.

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Open Lutris from the command line.
2. Select a runner that has some visible entries
3. Select a runner that doesn't have any visible entries (the errors will be displayed)

title: "Create a sandbox for wine folders" seemingly ignored and forcing sandbox directory creation
body:
**Describe the bug**

The soft links to my home directory to save my game files are always replaced by Wine sandbox folders when I start a Wine and Wine-Steam game.

**Expected behavior**

The "Create a sandbox for wine folders" setting is turned off. The Wine application must refer to my home directory to store game saves.

**Current behavior**

With turned off "Create a sandbox for wine folders", starting a game via Wine/Wine-Steam does always forcefully replace any soft links to my home/documents directory.

**Steps to reproduce**

- Open the "Runner Options" for any Wine/Wine Steam game in Lutris 0.5.5
- Make sure "Create a sandbox for wine folders" is turned off for the game
- Go to e.g. `/home/*user*/.local/share/lutris/runners/winesteam/prefix64/drive_c/users/*user*/` and make sure your "My Documents" is actually a soft link to `/home/*user*/Documents`
- Start the game via Lutris
- See that the soft link was replaced by a normal directory in `/home/*user*/.local/share/lutris/runners/winesteam/prefix64/drive_c/users/*user*/`

**System information**

Fedora 31, Kernel 5.15, German locale. Details see file below.
[lutris-issue-report.zip](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/4467247/lutris-issue-report.zip)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/http/client.py", line 1096, in putrequest
    self._output(self._encode_request(request))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/http/client.py", line 1176, in _encode_request
    return request.encode('ascii')
```

**System information**

[lutris-issue-report.json.gz](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/4409972/lutris-issue-report.json.gz)

title: Sort by play time incorrect
body:
The sorting by play time does not behave correctly, it will sort according to each digit separately, instead of sorting the entire number. (probably sorting on text and not on integer values)

For example:
- What happens: 3 hours > 20 hours > 100 hours, because 3 > 2 > 1
- What I expect: 100 hours > 20 hours > 3 hours

I'm currently using lutris version 0.5.4.

title: Cannot start wine games without pulseaudio
body:
**Describe the bug**

Starting a game that uses a wine runne does not work without pulse-audio installed since the pulse audio reset is called no matter what.
It is worth noting that playing games on wine without pulseaudio still works, even though jack support is officially removed. 


**Expected behavior**

I can start the game.

**Current behavior**

The game cannot be started due to pulseaudio not being installed.

**Steps to reproduce**

- Start a game with wine runner without having pulseaudio installed

**Lutris debugging output**
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/exceptions.py", line 26, in wrapper
    return function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/game.py", line 377, in configure_game
    audio.reset_pulse()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/audio.py", line 9, in reset_pulse
    subprocess.Popen(["pulseaudio", "--kill"])
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/subprocess.py", line 854, in __init__
    self._execute_child(args, executable, preexec_fn, close_fds,
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/subprocess.py", line 1702, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'pulseaudio'
```

title: Cannot launch games with wine as the runner
body:
Lutris shows the following error in a popup window when opening a game with wine as the runner:
> symlink: src should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not NoneType

On closing this, it shows:
> An error prevented the game from running

On running lutris from the terminal with the `-d` flag, this is the output that is received:
```python
DEBUG    2020-02-20 11:15:51,802 [game.play:295]:Prelaunching <lutris.runners.wine.wine object at 0x7f27500daac0>
ERROR    2020-02-20 11:15:51,831 [jobs.target:32]:Error while completing task <bound method wine.prelaunch of <lutris.runners.wine.wine object at 0x7f27500daac0>>: symlink: src should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not NoneType
<class 'TypeError'> symlink: src should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not NoneType
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/jobs.py", line 30, in target
    result = self.function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 791, in prelaunch
    self.sandbox(prefix_manager)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 949, in sandbox
    wine_prefix.desktop_integration(restore=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/prefix.py", line 124, in desktop_integration
    os.symlink(xdgshortcuts.get_xdg_entry(DESKTOP_XDG[i]), path)
ERROR    2020-02-20 11:15:51,832 [game.configure_game:312]:symlink: src should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not NoneType
ERROR    2020-02-20 11:15:53,425 [game.configure_game:315]:Game prelaunch unsuccessful
```

This occurs for any game with wine as the runner. Here are the contents of `~/.config/lutris/runners/wine.yml`:
```yml
system: {}
wine:
  autoconf_joypad: false
  d9vk: true
  d9vk_version: Manual
  dxvk: true
  dxvk_version: Manual
  esync: true
  overrides:
    mscoree: d
    mshtml: d
  sandbox: false
```
Here are the contents of `~/.config/lutris/system.yml`:
```yml
system:
  game_path: /mnt/Data/Games
  optimus: 'off'
  prelaunch_command: /mnt/Data/Programs/Bash/before_game.sh
  reset_desktop: true
  vk_icd: /usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_icd.json
```
For reference, here are the contents of `/mnt/Data/Programs/Bash/before_game.sh`:
```sh
#!/usr/bin/zsh
xset dpms 0 0 0
```

Note that I am able to run these games when I run them using wine from the command line. The issue occurs when I run them through Lutris. I have tried deleting the game runners from lutris and recreating them from Lutris's GUI, but the problem persists.

My system configuration is:
* OS: Arch Linux
* Lutris version: lutris-0.5.4
* Wine version: wine-5.0-419-g1a7d5eaf58 (this is Valve's version of wine, from [wine-valve-git](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/wine-valve-git/), modified to use the "proton_5.0" branch)
* DXVK version: 1.5.4, installed into my wine prefix using `setup_dxvk install --symlink`
* DE: Xfce 4.14 (for daily use), Openbox 3.6.1 inside [nvidia-xrun](https://github.com/Witko/nvidia-xrun) (for gaming with Lutris)

title: Lutris isn't downloading the runtime files
body: **Describe the bug** As mentioned in issue #1539, downloading of lib32 and lib64 aren't working (nor are most of the other runtime files). They're not valid gzip/bzip2 files: ``` $ cat lib32.tar.bz2 InvalidArgumenttx000000000000000307b5c-005e3ae7b7-340a218-nyc3a340a218-nyc3a-nyc ``` The trick in issue #1539 of downloading and extracting them manually doesn't work either, because Lutris deletes the downloaded and extracted files and tries to download them again, but again, they're not valid and so I still get warnings about missing files and invalid gzip/bzip2 files. I got Lutris not to delete the extracted files by making them readonly, but I still get stderr messages about being unable to extract the files (and it shouldn't make users go through such hurdles anyway): ``` 2020-02-08 19:51:50,107: Runtime update failed 2020-02-08 19:51:50,108: not a gzip file 2020-02-08 19:51:50,109: Runtime update failed 2020-02-08 19:51:50,109: not a gzip file 2020-02-08 19:51:50,110: Runtime update failed 2020-02-08 19:51:50,110: not a bzip2 file 2020-02-08 19:51:50,111: Runtime update failed 2020-02-08 19:51:50,111: not a bzip2 file 2020-02-08 19:51:50,112: Runtime update failed 2020-02-08 19:51:50,112: not a bzip2 file ``` **Expected behavior** The runtime files should download and extract correctly. **Current behavior** The runtime files don't download and extract correctly. **Steps to reproduce** Um, run Lutris from the command line. **Lutris debugging output** [log.txt](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/4176341/log.txt) **System information** The .json file created by typing `lutris --submit-issue` in a terminal. [lutris-issue-report.json](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/4176333/lutris-issue-report.txt) **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

title: Can't disconnect from HumbleBundle
body:
When I click on the disconnect button, it gives me this:
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/gui/widgets/services.py", line 133, in on_connect_clicked
    self.service.disconnect()
AttributeError: module 'lutris.services.humblebundle' has no attribute 'disconnect'
```
and doesn't disconnect me.

title: Failure to read Steam's config.vdf due to wrong case
body:
Lutris can't read Steam's config.vdf file because the "Steam" value is actually lowercase when Lutris expects it to be uppercase.

![19:05:34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17669985/72685104-730c4480-3aef-11ea-9217-4df94fac22bd.png)

Same as #1966.

title: Exclusion of processes no longer works (Wine runner)
body:
This only happens with current master. For example, if I try to install Itch.io app (https://lutris.net/games/itchio/), the installation will forever be stuck unless the user closes the client window that appears after the installation themselves, breaking the silent functionality of this installer. 
This does not happen in 0.5.4, and the whole installation process is completely silent.

title: Problem with user directories when sandboxing is disabled
body:
Hi, i have strange problem in recent version. I have disabled wineprefix sandboxing, so my user directories were configured as symlinks. But in recent version programs (or even wine config) do not start with error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 676, in run_winecfg
    self.prelaunch()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 778, in prelaunch
    self.sandbox(prefix_manager)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 926, in sandbox
    wine_prefix.desktop_integration(restore=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/prefix.py", line 132, in desktop_integration
    os.rename(old_path, path)
NotADirectoryError: [Errno 20] není adresářem: '/home/petr/.local/share/lutris/runners/winegames/drive_c/users/petr/Plocha.winecfg' -> '/home/petr/.local/share/lutris/runners/winegames/drive_c/users/petr/Plocha'

which is true, because "Plocha" is symlink to proper Desktop directory. When i delete "Plocha.winecfg", same error moves to next user directory "Mé dokumenty" (Documents). When i delete all "winecfg" files, all symlinks to existing user directories are replaced by empty directories. I.e. i am not able to run programs linked to standard user directories despite sandboxing is disabled.

title: PCSX2 Runner: Add config path/file options (Feature request)
body:
It would be nice to have a way to specify a config file as for example some games run better with a multi-threaded microVU than others. It would also enable to have different window sizes set for those seeking square pixels as some NTSC games run at 640x448 and others use 512x448. Same goes for PAL region games. :slightly_smiling_face: 

The command line is: `PCSX2 --cfg=<str>`

I'm absolutely fine if you put it on low priority as probably only few people use PCSX2 anyways. :wink:

title: Searching lutris.net from client searches forever. (master)
body:
When using the "Search on lutris.net" button **on the master branch**, the search never completes and results do not show up.

title: Steam play time not tracked
body: When you launch a steam game via lutris, lutris doesn't keep track of the time you spend ingame. IE been playing Endless Sky, and according to Steam I've played 3 hours, and according to lutris I've only played 1 minute

title: Games launched through shortcuts launch with fallback version of DXVK
body:
If you launch a game using a shortcut (or directly through terminal with a command like this `lutris  lutris:rungameid/109`) that DXVK without the version specified, the game will launch with a fallback DXVK version.
This doesn't happen if your turn off the internet or if you specify the version.
I suspect that this happens because Lutris modifies `dxvk_versions.json` on launch, so when Lutris also simultaneously tries to determine which latest version of DXVK it should use before launching the game, it fails to do that (as the file is being modified/changed) and uses the fallback version.
To fix this, Lutris might need to change the way it updates the `dxvk_versions.json` to avoid this issue.

title: Lutris doesn't detect Steam libraries on external hard drives
body: In Steam I've got my default library pointed to an external hard drive, Lutris however doesn't detect the games there and I can't find any way to force Lutris to detect it.
