title: Unable to install Wine Steam game
body:
**Describe the bug**

When installing a Wine Steam the installer raises a exception and gets stuck at the screen prompting you to click install


**Expected behavior**

Installation of the game

**Current behavior**

Getting stuck on the first screen

**Steps to reproduce**

- Install the latest Lutris commit (I used the [lutris-git](https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/sentry/lutris-git) copr)
- try to install a Wine Steam game

**Lutris debugging output**
I've gone through the debugging output and found this traceback
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/gui/installerwindow.py", line 252, in on_install_clicked
    self.interpreter.check_runner_install()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/installer/interpreter.py", line 470, in check_runner_install
    default_wine["architecture"]
KeyError: 'winesteam'
```
I am fairly sure f188a2f0f99fb4cdd40cc6d2e60cafc9da4c1ce8 has caused this and running a commit before that makes it work fine



**System information**
[lutris-issue-report.json](
https://gist.github.com/Jan200101/c1931998f316270e00dd5eb735f3724e).

title: Game configuration gets cleared after downloading a new wine version
body:
How to reproduce
1) Pick a game entry from library that uses Wine runner and specifies at least executable.
2) Open configuration, select `Game Info` tab.
3) Click `Install Runners`
4) Find Wine runner and click on "Manage Versions" button.
5) Download a wine build (i downloaded `lutris-4.12.1` but I imagine it doesn't matter).
6) After it was successfully downloaded and extracted, click `OK` in the `Manage Wine versions` window to close it.
7) Without closing the runners list, save the game configuration.

Expected behavior: configuration is preserved and remains the same
Observed behavior: configuration gets completely cleared and reset to defaults.

title: Unable to start games if your username starts with "x"
body:
**Describe the bug**

Well, this is an odd one, isn't it. In commit https://github.com/lutris/lutris/commit/1f9953e9bcc9d68e0c8a5f03e83a45761484aba, a function `decode_unicode` is added (On line R292). It is, among other things, called with the user path (`C:\\users\\username`)

Within that function, the passed in string gets split on `\x`, in an attempt to find unicode escape sequences like `\x5c`. Unfortunately, it also find occurences of a literal backslash followed by an x, as is the case with the path to my user directory: `C:\\users\\xandaros`.
This results in the string being improperly split and the first part ends up with a single backslash at the end, which is then passed into `decode`, where it will complain about the backslash.

**Lutris debugging output**
```
$ lutris lutris:rungame/warframe
2019-11-22 02:29:00,425: Running Lutris 0.5.3
2019-11-22 02:29:00,425: Using NVIDIA drivers 440.31 for x86_64
2019-11-22 02:29:00,425: GPU: GeForce GTX 970
2019-11-22 02:29:00,426: GPU: 10DE:13C2 19DA:1366 using nvidia drivers
2019-11-22 02:29:00,461: Vulkan is supported
2019-11-22 02:29:00,462: Updating DXVK versions
2019-11-22 02:29:01,312: Updating D9VK versions
Decoding: C:\\users\\xandaros\\Desktop
2019-11-22 02:29:02,524: Error while completing task <bound method wine.prelaunch of <lutris.runners.wine.wine object at 0x7f33901083a0>>: 'unicodeescape' codec can't decode byte 0x5c in position 9: \ at end of string
<class 'UnicodeDecodeError'> 'unicodeescape' codec can't decode byte 0x5c in position 9: \ at end of string
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/jobs.py", line 30, in target
    result = self.function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 791, in prelaunch
    self.sandbox(prefix_manager)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 945, in sandbox
    wine_prefix.desktop_integration(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/prefix.py", line 98, in desktop_integration
    _desktop_folders = self.get_desktop_folders()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/prefix.py", line 82, in get_desktop_folders
    folder = self.get_registry_key(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/prefix.py", line 52, in get_registry_key
    return registry.query(self.get_key_path(key), subkey)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/registry.py", line 164, in query
    return key.get_subkey(subkey)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/registry.py", line 342, in get_subkey
    return self.decode_unicode(value[1:-1])
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/lutris/util/wine/registry.py", line 298, in decode_unicode
    out = chunks.pop(0).encode().decode("unicode_escape")
2019-11-22 02:29:02,525: 'unicodeescape' codec can't decode byte 0x5c in position 9: \ at end of string
2019-11-22 02:29:06,520: Game prelaunch unsuccessful
2019-11-22 02:29:08,532: Shutting down Lutris
```

The "Decoding: " line was added by me to investigate this issue.

**System information**

Probably irrelevant, but here you go: [lutris-issue-report.txt](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/3877548/lutris-issue-report.txt)

**Potential Fix**

I have fixed this issue locally by adding `[^\\]` in front of the search string for the split. It works for me, but I don't know the wider implications, so I have not submitted a PR. (I'm also lazy :P)

https://lutris.net/games/a-test-mtga-test/installer/edit

title: Add directory field and "Move" action to game config dialog.
body:
**Describe the bug**

When Lutris sets the `directory` key in pga.db and the location of the parent folder of `games` folder changes, `directory` isn't updated resulting in failing to execute pre-launch/post-end scripts (no permission at old location).
Here while trying to launch Overwatch pre-launch script:
(`/Lutris` was the old folder, `/Lutris2` the new)
```
ERROR    2019-11-03 16:58:00,974 [command.execute_process:230]:Failed to execute /usr/bin/lutris-wrapper 1 0 ctrl_fix_start.sh /Lutris2/games/overwatch/ctrl_fix_start.sh: [Errno 13] No permission: '/Lutris'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/command.py", line 219, in execute_process
    os.makedirs(self.cwd)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 211, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 211, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 221, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
PermissionError: [Errno 13] No permission: '/Lutris'
```

**Expected behavior**

`directory` key should get updated

**Steps to reproduce**

- Install a game which has a prelaunch script and let Lutris set the `directory` key (e.g. Overwatch)
- Change the location of the parent folder of  the `directory` key on the drive
- Update all locations in Lutris UI
- Start the game and the start/stop script will fail (see above)

body:
If game has  trademark symbol (™) on its name lutris will add it to identifier during parsing.

**Expected behavior**

For example i have DARK SOULS™: REMASTERED installed on Steam with proton. Game has id on _[lutris.net](https://lutris.net/games/dark-souls-remastered/)_: **dark-souls-remastered**. I expecting that lutris will parse correct id to my library.

**Current behavior**

Lutris has parsed **dark-soulstm-remastered** id which is wrong.

Any game with trademark symbol affected. For example HITMAN™, STAR WARS™ Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast™ etc.

title: Lutris doesn't show right and left panel by default
body:
This is a very serious issue, because now new users, by default, only see this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10602045/65707831-f8c63900-e095-11e9-8845-78819d1e3fdc.png)
which is very confusing, as Lutris is missing half of its UI, and it's not obvious it even exists as it's hidden under an option in a menu!
If you already have Lutris installed, reproduction is very easy: you just need to remove `lutris.conf` file from `~/.cache`.

title: Starting wineconsole from client does not work as intended
body:
When I implemented the option to run `wineconsole` from Lutris to close #2199, I intended it so that the `wineconsole` opens up in prefix directory to cut down on the `cd` commands required to navigate to the prefix. This was achieved by implementing a method which calls `wineexec` and passes working directory as an argument (PR #2213).

When the fix for #2289 was implemented (https://github.com/lutris/lutris/commit/b043071eee248f19ad3c1761bab932daebb29738), the code was changed to run `wineconsole` by calling `_run_executable("wineconsole")` instead of calling `wineexec` directly. In the current implementation, the working directory argument is ignored, therefore the `wineconsole` starts in /home/\<username\> instead of the prefix's directory. I assume this was not indeded.

**Expected behavior**
`wineconsole` should start in prefix directory:
`C:\Program Files (x86)\Battle.net`

**Current behavior**

`wineconsole` starts in user's home directory:
`Z:\home\dino8890`

**Steps to reproduce**

- Right click on any game running on Wine,
- click on 'Wine console' option.

**Proposed solutions**
If this is indeed a bug, I propose the following solutions in order of preference:

1. implement a method similar to `_run_executable` which accepts working_dir argument,
2. modify `run_wineconsole` method so that it calls `wineexec` directly, bypassing the `_run_executable` method or
3. add an if test inside `wineexec` method, setting the `working_dir` if the executable is `wineconsole`.

I can fix this myself, no problem, I just want to confirm this behaviour was not intended.

title: Error re-generating winesteam
body:
**Describe the bug**
Lutris fails to create the runner Wine Steam.

**Steps to reproduce**

- Delete the content of ~/.local/share/lutris/runners/winesteam/
- Open lutris and click the play button on the left bar > Wine Steam.

**Screenshots**
![tmp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3357792/61495594-b4ddf600-a9b9-11e9-954f-d0d0162d96f9.png)
The error.

![tmp2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3357792/61495639-cf17d400-a9b9-11e9-9324-fc768d8f58e0.png)
The same error, but with "Lutris -d"

**Workaround**

* Create an empty wine prefix with the command 

      WINEPREFIX="/a/folder/of/your/choice/" winecfg

* Use winetricks to install steam on the prefix you just created.
* Copy the content of the generated directory to ~/.local/share/lutris/runners/winesteam/
* Open lutris and click the play button on the left bar > Wine Steam.

title: Lutris removes "DXVK" dlls even when they're not from DXVK
body:
**Describe the bug**

It is currently not possible to use Gallium Nine, when DXVK is disabled in the settings (which would be what I thought would be necessary to run Gallium Nine). When I enable Gallium Nine and then run a game I get these messages in the console:

```
2019-06-17 10:21:30,859: Removing DXVK dll /home/bjoern/Games/starcraft-ii/drive_c/windows/system32/d3d9
2019-06-17 10:21:30,859: Removing DXVK dll /home/bjoern/Games/starcraft-ii/drive_c/windows/syswow64/d3d9
```

Afterwards the game complains about a missiing d3d9.dll
Enabling DXVK and setting the version to manual makes it work.

**Expected behavior**

Game runs with Gallium Nine.

**Current behavior**

Game complains about a missiing d3d9.dll

**Steps to reproduce**

* Install Gallium Nine via winetricks.
* Enable Gallium Nine by running drive_c/windows/syswo64/ninewinecfg.exe
* Disable DXVK.
* Run game.

**Workarounds**

Any of these should work:

* Set DXVK-version to manual and enable DXVK.
* Run the game manually from the console and not via lutris.
* It would probably work to run the game exe manually via "Run EXE inside wine prefix".

title: [Runner dosbox] `Command arguments` setting will be ignored when multiple arguments are specified
body:
**Describe the bug**

The dosbox runner has a Game option `Command arguments` which just adds arguments to the dosbox command. This works fine for single arguments like 
```-version```
, but does not work when several arguments (separated by space) are stated, e.g. 
```-c pause```
or
```-c "imgmount d someimage.iso" -c "cd path"```
.

**Expected behavior**

All command arguments should be honored when dosbox gets started. Note that the extra arguments will be correctly executed when directly copying the full command from the lutris logs into a console. Thus the dosbox command is correctly build.
Looking at the source https://github.com/lutris/lutris/blob/master/lutris/runners/dosbox.py#L152 all arguments are just appended as a single string. I'm no python expert but I think each argument should be added separately, similar like here  https://github.com/lutris/lutris/blob/master/lutris/runners/commands/dosbox.py#L33

**Current behavior**

Command arguments will be ignored when multiple arguments separated by space are specified.

**Steps to reproduce**

- Enter 
```-c pause```
as Command arguments in a dosbox runner
- Observe that the `pause` is ignored during startup.

title: Lutris Crashes Outright, doesn't get to gui
body:
After installing lutris on Arch Linux from the official Arch repos, the python code crashes upon starting the application and I never see the GUI or anything except the Traceback when lutris is ran from the terminal. After google searches I cannot figure this out for some reason.

I am running Arch Linux on a laptop that has both Intel Integrated Graphics and an Nvidia 940MX. 

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/lutris", line 31, in <module>
    from lutris.gui.application import Application
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 33, in <module>
    from lutris import pga
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/pga.py", line 10, in <module>
    from lutris.util import sql, system
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/system.py", line 10, in <module>
    from lutris.util.linux import LINUX_SYSTEM
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/linux.py", line 374, in <module>
    LINUX_SYSTEM = LinuxSystem()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/linux.py", line 125, in __init__
    self.populate_libraries()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/linux.py", line 300, in populate_libraries
    for req in self.requirements:
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/linux.py", line 216, in requirements
    return self.get_requirements()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/linux.py", line 245, in get_requirements
    if drivers.is_amd():
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/graphics/drivers.py", line 80, in is_amd
    if get_gpu_info(card)["DRIVER"] == "amdgpu":
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/site-packages/lutris/util/graphics/drivers.py", line 64, in get_gpu_info
    with open("/sys/class/drm/%s/device/uevent" % card) as card_uevent:
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/sys/class/drm/card1/device/uevent'
```
Any attempt to run the submit issue command argument with lutris fails and returns the same traceback before it can actually fulfill the command.

title: ResidualVM runner
body:
Hello,
the ResidualVM runner does not work on my config: Ubuntu 19.04.
When I launch a game I obtained this error message:

$ ~/.local/share/lutris/runners/residualvm/residualvm: error while loading shared libraries: libGLEW.so.1.13: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Could you compile a more static version or join this library to your runtime? or?

Thank you for your help.

config: Ubuntu 19.04 - GPU Nvidia

title: Old native GOG installers broken due to name conflict
body:
**Describe the bug**

See: https://github.com/RobLoach/net.lutris.Lutris/issues/51

When you download a game from GOG; in this case Mount and Blade Warband, and lutris tries to install it Lutris is unable to extract the game. 


**Expected behavior**

The game should install normally with no extraction issues. 

**Current behavior**

`Error("Destination path '/home/apattyn/.var/app/net.lutris.Lutris/cache/lutris/installer/mount-blade-warband/unzip' already exists")`

Although it is the same issue with lutris from the default fedora repos (`0.5.2.1-1.fc30`). 

**Steps to reproduce**

- Import game from GOG (that supports linux)
- Install the game.
- Once download is finished see error popup.

title: Discord RPC connection: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'write'
body:
When you run Lutris with the new DRP (Discord Rich Presence) addition, while not having discord open the following gets dumped on the terminal:

```

    self.loop.run_until_complete(self.handshake())

title: Discord Rich Presence
body:
The current Implementation doesn't work and it cause problems with certain games. It also spam the terminal with "Discord Rich Presence enabled".

I Tested it, as it is currently implemented , there is no way to activate it as https://github.com/lutris/lutris/commit/780ef9713f91f8c09d59c3a0923bc2713722a7b0 implement the "if PyPresence is not None" the wrong way around, but even fixing it (locally) it still don't work. My  guess is that it detects pypresence incorrectly.

Using "pip freeze" it states that pypresence==3.3.2 yet "Discord Rich Presence not available due to lack of pypresence" get spammed to the terminal. 

Another issue is that you can't turn Discord Rich Presence of globally, you need to do it for every game, that can be tedious on a large library, Better implementation would be to have DRP turned of globally, and either have a option to turn it on or of globally or independently per game.


@jaymehoward @tannisroot

title: Lutris switches right panel to a stopped game regardless of its previous state.
body:
How to reproduce:
1. Select a game and launch it
2. Unselect it (by selecting a different game or none at all)
3. Close the game without using Lutris client (for example, by exiting it through in-game menu) so that process manager picks up that the game has closed itself.

Expected behavior: Right panel keeps its current state (selected on a different game or just showing default menu)
Observed behavior: Right panel switches to the game that has just closed.

title: ProcessLookupError: [Errno 3] No such process
body:
Reported by multiple users on Discord (I think this gets printed after they try to stop a game?).
As there is `lutris-wrapper` involed, I should notify @AaronOpfer.

title: Lutris Wine installer fails to run commands because of missing architecture suffix in version name
body:
Lutris can download these versions no problem but the Wine commands look for the folder without the suffix so they fail to run. Not only that, but if you try rerunning it will redownload the same version.

```
files:
- setup: https://remoteplay.dl.playstation.net/remoteplay/module/win/RemotePlayInstaller.exe
game:
  exe: drive_c/Program Files (x86)/Sony/PS4 Remote Play/RemotePlay.exe
  prefix: $GAMEDIR
installer:
- task:
    name: create_prefix
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- task:
    app: vcrun2013 dotnet472 win10
    description: Installing .NET 4.7.2
    name: winetricks
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- task:
    args: /extract
    executable: setup
    name: wineexec
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- move:
    dst: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files (x86)/Sony/PS4 Remote Play
    src: $CACHE/setup/B3CD2F9
- copy:
    dst: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/windows/syswow64
    src: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files (x86)/Sony/PS4 Remote Play/scenp.dll
wine:
  version: ge-warframe-protonified-4.7
```

title: Lutris defaults antialiasing to "0" and overrides any in-app options for all wined3d games
body:
Because of this, all games are forced to disable smoothing and it can't be changed in-game, only in Lutris config. 
Caused by https://github.com/lutris/lutris/pull/1609 from @TRPB .

title: theme.load_icon prevents importing installed desktop games
body:
Hey all,
When I try to import games I installed before testing lutris, it shows the loading animation forever...
According to the traceback (when starting lutris from the terminal) there is a problem with theme.load_icon:

title: Game config empty after installing game
body:
If a previous install is removed and the game panel is still focused on it the config shows up empty after install. Game launches fine though. Just a small quirk I found.

Edit: I've found if you open the config window and close it without saving it populates the entry fields like it should.

Demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_vurJMQIIE

title: "Show Logs" option in the contextual menu is always inactive
body: Even if the log button in the right panel is accessible, the "Snow Logs" option in the contextual menu (accessibile through right click) is not.

title: Stack overflow when downloading GOG games with multiple installer versions.
body:
In lutris/installer/interpreter.py, in the function swap_gog_game_files, all GOG game files ending with '.exe' or '.sh' are added under the same file id.
This causes an infinite recursion in iter_game_files + _download_file, because the files overwrite each other in the game_files dictionary.

Here is a workaround that just allows only the first .exe/.sh file to make it into the files array:
[a.diff.txt](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/3050648/a.diff.txt)

title: Importing of Steam games that are already in the library (uninstalled) does not make them appear installed
body:
How to reproduce:
1. Add a game to your game library on Lutris.Net
2. Relaunch Lutris to let it fetch the new data and add the game to the library
3. Have that game installed locally through Steam
4. Import the game through "Import Games" menu

Expected behavior: the game now appears in the library as installed and is ready to be launched
Observed Behavior: nothing happens, the game remains uninstalled in the library until you manually run the installer it

A lot of users get confused by this because they think the Importing process failed as nothing happens after the importing process.

title: Multiple Proton versions all show as the same version in Lutris
body:
On my Ubuntu machine I just installed the newest Lutris from the ppa/repo on the Lutris site, I had both Proton 3.16 and 4.2 installed in Stream but in Lutris they both showed as "Proton 3.16 (default)". It was actually listed twice, and when I added Proton 3.7 in steam it just made a third Proton 3.16 (default) in lutris.

After removing all but 4.2, then finally it showed as Proton 4.2 in lutris, but after re installing 3.16, the same issue came back, except this time it is showing a double "Proton 4.2 (default)"

Just figured I would report it!

title: write_config screwing with dosbox config
body:
Editing a config file with the `- write_config` command changes drive names because it thinks it's a key. This causes the game to fail when launching.

```
[autoexec]
@ECHO OFF
mount C "."
mount d "." -t cdrom
c:
cls
SET ARENADATA=C:
d:
ACD -Ssbpdig.adv -IOS220 -IRQS7 -DMAS1 -Mgenmidi.adv -IOM330 -IRQM2 -DMAM1
Exit
```
Becomes:
```
[autoexec]
@ECHO OFF
mount C "."
mount d "." -t cdrom
c=
cls
SET ARENADATA=C:
d=
ACD -Ssbpdig.adv -IOS220 -IRQS7 -DMAS1 -Mgenmidi.adv -IOM330 -IRQM2 -DMAM1
Exit
```
Test installer:
```
name: The Elder Scrolls Arena
game_slug: the-elder-scrolls-arena
version: Freeware 1.07
slug: the-elder-scrolls-arena
runner: dosbox

script:
  files:
  - setup: http://theelderscrolls.wiwiland.net/Fichiers/ArenaSetup.exe
  game:
    config_file: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Games/Bethesda Softworks/Arena/DosBox.conf
    main_file: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Games/Bethesda Softworks/Arena/ACD.EXE
  installer:
  - task:
      args: /LANG=en /SP- /SILENT
      description: I don't know how to stop it from opening the browser. Sorry.
      executable: setup
      name: wine.wineexec
  - write_config:
      file: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Games/Bethesda Softworks/Arena/DosBox.conf
      key: fullscreen
      section: sdl
      value: false
  system: {}
```

title: Compositor is not re-enabled after a game stops when using "disable_compositor"

milestone.title: 0.5.x
milestone.description: Lutris 0.5 cycle, including all minor versions.

body:
**What works:**
The compositor is disabled when the game is launched (XFCE)

**What doesn't work:**
The compositor is not re-enabled after the game stops (XFCE).

title: Manual installation of GOG games does not progress
body:
How to reproduce:
1. Log out of GOG if not already
2. Try installing a GOG game (i used https://lutris.net/games/mirrors-edge/)
3. Refuse to login and select the installer EXE manually.
4. Refuse to login again (caused by https://github.com/lutris/lutris/issues/1925), proceed installation

Observed behavior: the installer installs files and Lutris reports that it exited gracefully:
```Waiting on children
Waiting on children
All children gone
```
but it will not progress to the next installation step after that and will be stuck on current one.
Expected behavior: the installation progresses normally

I should note that this does not happen (with the same installer) when you are logged in.

title: Lutris fails to open for some users
body:
Lutris opens the donation page https://lutris.net/donate but doesn't open the donation message window.

>Clicking "install" on the WINE GOG version results in an error window popping up after I select "open with Lutris" and instantly closes, then the "become a patreon supporter, etc" page shows up in a new browser tab

Issue reported on: https://lutris.net/games/assassins-creed/

>Nice. Running Lutris now just takes me to the donate page for Lutris.net. Can't load any games :P

title: Lutris crashes on startup when gvfs is missing
body:
Reported by a user on Discord:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 221, in do_command_line
    run_all_checks()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/startup.py", line 154, in run_all_checks
    check_donate()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/startup.py", line 121, in check_donate
    open_uri("https://lutris.net/donate")
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/gui/widgets/utils.py", line 42, in open_uri
    Gtk.show_uri(None, uri, Gdk.CURRENT_TIME)
GLib.Error: g-io-error-quark: Operation not supported (15)
INFO     2019-03-23 14:02:16,819 [application.do_shutdown:441]:Shutting down Lutris
```
They fixed it by installing `gvfs-backends`. In that case, Lutris should add it as a dependency as well.

body:
Traceback: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/SJhCwfBgkq/
This can be easily reproducible by being logged in to GOG, launching the installer and then turning the internet off, but this will also happen if GOG for whatever reason is unavailable (like if it's ISP blocked) and even if the game is stored in cache.

title: Game library (lutriswindow.py) no longer opens when installing games if Lutris isn't already opened
body:
How to reproduce:
1. Completely close Lutris
2. Click "Install" on the website

Observed behavior: Only the installation window opens, nothing else.
Expected behavior: Installer windows opens _along_ with the main window with the game library.

It's probably caused by https://github.com/lutris/lutris/pull/1885

title: Lutris show a new launcher each time I launch or configure a game.
body:
Hello,

I have this issue on Lutris: each time I launch or configure a game, Lutris shows a new launcher icon. As you can see on this screen capture, I launched Splinter Cell 7 times and configured it one time. So Lutris shows 9 launcher icon.

![Capture d’écran de 2019-03-20 07-35-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/325405/54663886-04331900-4ae3-11e9-900d-4a68b2c61415.png)
Same issue if I try to remove a launcher icon.
After Lutris restart, there was only one launcher icon again.

I joined you the Lutris log.
[lutris.log](https://github.com/lutris/lutris/files/2986814/lutris.log)

Lutris version: today's git.
Config: Ubuntu 18.04 Nividia GPU

title: crash on startup opensuse leap 15 KDE
body:
### I recently installed OpenSUSE Leap 15 KDE, I followed the next steps to install lutris:
`  sudo zypper addrepo https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:strycore/openSUSE_Leap_15.0/home:strycore.repo
;sudo zypper refresh
 ;sudo zypper install lutris
`

### And now when i try to launch it i get this output:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/lutris", line 31, in <module>
    from lutris.gui.application import Application
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/gui/application.py", line 34, in <module>
    from lutris.game import Game
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/game.py", line 14, in <module>
    from lutris.runners import import_runner, InvalidRunner, wine
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 11, in <module>
    from lutris.runners.runner import Runner
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/runners/runner.py", line 7, in <module>
    from lutris.config import LutrisConfig
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/config.py", line 6, in <module>
    from lutris import settings, sysoptions
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/sysoptions.py", line 6, in <module>
    from lutris.util import display, system
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/util/display.py", line 241, in <module>
    DISPLAY_MANAGER = DisplayManager()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/lutris/util/display.py", line 221, in __init__
    self.rr_screen = GnomeDesktop.RRScreen.new(screen)
TypeError: Argument 0 does not allow None as a value

### THINGS I TRIED
installing `gnome-desktop` which displays that `libgnome-desktop-3-12` is already installed
manual setting of env variable `DISPLAY=:1`

### Related to this
i found this issue posted, where they talk about something happened to me, i got this problem and i ignored dependencies breaking as he did. But it didn't work for me.
https://github.com/lutris/lutris/issues/1813

title: Launchers added to ZDoom runner not working as of 0.5
body:
As the title suggests gzdoom games added after the 0.5 update don't work. Launchers added in version 0.4 keep on working as intended.

I use the gzdoom version installed in my system and configured the runner to use /usr/bin/gzdoom accordingly instead of the download version from Lutris. My config files for it are also properly configured and launching any game/mod from any folder in a terminal works. As I do use quite a bunch of mods while playing Doom, I prefer using the command line arguments field instead of the other separate available fields to load multiple mods at a time. For example my Doom II commanline field looks like this:
`-iwad doom2.wad -file Maps.of.Chaos.1.27.Overkill.pk3 Bolognese.2.0.pk3 Bolognese.2.0.VM.pk3`
I have made that entry on 0.4 and it works perfectly fine.

After trying to add new entries, the games won't launch. When trying to launch with the side bars active, the play button turns inactive reading "Launching...". I made a new entry to simply launch gzdoom without arguments and the lutris -d output is the following:

```
DEBUG    2019-03-01 23:42:08,973 [game.play:257]:Prelaunching <lutris.runners.zdoom.zdoom object at 0x7f400f8479b0>
WARNING  2019-03-01 23:42:08,974 [zdoom.prelaunch:101]:FluidSynth is not installed, you might not have any music
DEBUG    2019-03-01 23:42:08,980 [display._get_vidmodes:15]:Retrieving video modes from XrandR
DEBUG    2019-03-01 23:42:09,070 [game.configure_game:293]:Launching Doom Test: {'command': ['/usr/bin/gzdoom']}
DEBUG    2019-03-01 23:42:09,070 [game.configure_game:294]:Game info: {
  "command": [
    "/usr/bin/gzdoom"
  ]

title: Do not overwrite file by another one with the same name in cache (with default cache path one in .cache)
body:
So for example, if I make an installer that downloasd 2 versions of the same file with the same name (32 and 64 bit):
```files:
- mfplat_dll_64: https://lutris.net/files/tools/dll/mfplat/x64/mfplat.dll
- mfplat_dll_32: https://lutris.net/files/tools/dll/mfplat/x32/mfplat.dll```
Lutris overwrite the first file  (mfplat_dll_64) with the second one (mfplat_dll_32), as they have the same name, instead of keeping both. As a result, the script will be borked.

title: Lutris doesn't handle cache path correctly
body:
For example, if I choose 
>/home/MY_USERNAME/lutris-cache

as a cache folder, it will show up as `~/lutris-cache` in the UI, and for some reason Lutris will instead create and use 

>/home/MY_USERNAME/**~/lutris-cache**

to store cache files.

title: Lutris sometimes displays the game 2 times after installation
body:
I can't reliably reproduce this but this happened to other users as well (but when importing games).
Restarting Lutris gets rid of the duplicate.
Some terminal output I got when that happened: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/hcqYrhcYrg/

title: Lutris can't stop unresponsive processes
body:
If the process for some reason isn't responsive or refuses to close, pressing `Stop` won't work and Lutris will never be able to shut down the game without manual intervention.
Should probably mention @AaronOpfer.

title: Don't remove installation files after cancelling installation if another installer is open
body:
How to reproduce:
1. Use an installer that downloads files (like https://lutris.net/games/the-sims/)
2. Start the installation, continue until installer downloads installation files (which happens after selecting installation directory)
3. After that, without cancelling existing installation, use the same installer and repeat step 2
4. Cancel the first installation and close the window.

As a result, Lutris removes installation files in `~./cache/lutris/installer/`, and the other installer doesn't execute correctly and errors out due to missing files.

In the log, I see:
```Removing folder /home/alex/.cache/lutris/installer/the-sims```
So perhaps, the issue could be resolved by giving each installer instance a unique name for the cache folder. So instead of just `the-sims`, it could be `the-sims-654656654`.

title: DXVK overrides get shown in DLL Overrides section while the game is running, remain if config is changed during that

milestone.description: First 0.5 release with GOG support and updated Gtk UI.

body:
How to reproduce:
1. Enable DXVK, save.
2. Launch the game.
3. Open Configuration while the game is still running
4. Change any option (for example, DXVK), save.
5. Stop the game.

Observed behavior: While the game is still running, DXVK overrides (d3d11, dxgi, etc.) are shown in `DLL Overrides` section. If you change configuration during that, for example, disable DXVK, these overrides will actually be saved into game configuration despite DXVK being disabled, leading to issues with WineD3D afterwards.
Expected behavior: none of what is described above.

_Note: if you actually don't change or open configuration while the game is still running, the overrides will not be shown in configuration after stopping the game._

![peek 2019-01-13 18-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10602045/51087597-692a6580-1766-11e9-9f27-186d03ec02e4.gif)

title: Game is falsely shown as running (but can't be stopped) after receiving esync warning

milestone.description: First 0.5 release with GOG support and updated Gtk UI.

body:
How to reproduce:
1. Change open file limits set to lower than 1 million, reboot.
2. Open yaml file for the game in `~/.config/lutris/`, in `wine` section, add `esync: true`, save.
3. Launch the game
4. Get Esync warning, press ok without checking the "run anyway" checkbox.
_Note: steps 1-2 are required to simulate a situation when a bad system update changes previously set limits to lower than neeeded._

Observed behavior: `Play` button turn to `Stop` but pressing it doesn't do anything
Expected behavior: `Play` button should either never turn into `Stop` or turn back into `Play` after closing the warning without ignoring it.

5. Repeat steps from 2 to 4 until Lutris becomes completely unresponsive (usually takes 2-3 times)

title: Citra runner requires GLIBCXX_3.4.22 (libstdc++.so.6.0.22 or newer)
body:
The current citra-qt binary shipped with the Citra runner in Lutris 0.4.18 won't work on distros with libstdc++ older than libstdc++.so.6.0.22 (so IINM any distro shipping with GCC 5 or older by default).

This affects Mageia 6, and likely also Ubuntu 16.04.x and likely a variety of other distros from 2016/2017 (or earlier of course).

I don't know if you're shipping the upstream Citra binaries (which I confirm are not portable on older distros) or building them yourself. If building them yourself, you'd have to try to build them on a distro like Ubuntu 16.04 for good compatibility.

IIRC I tried to build Citra from source and it strictly required GCC 6 or newer, so a solution (for Lutris or ideally, for upstream) could be to try linking libstdc++ statically, passing `-static-libgcc -static-libstdc++` to the linker.

If that's not something that we can/want to fix in Lutris, there should maybe a libstdc++ version check before installing the Citra runner to prevent installing it where not supported. Currently trying to run this launcher just returns instantly, and shows this in the terminal:
```
/home/akien/.local/share/lutris/runners/citra/citra-qt: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.22' not found (required by /home/akien/.local/share/lutris/runners/citra/citra-qt)
```

title: Lutris closes Steam during log-in

milestone.title: 0.5.x
milestone.description: Lutris 0.5 cycle, including all minor versions.

body:
If a game uses Steam Wine runner and runs using a prefix that is different from default one (my assumption, not sure), after the installation Steam asks to log in again.
Because Lutris can't launch the game due to that, it thinks that game has been closed and closes Steam before the user can sign in to their account. It can take some time (minute or close to it) but it will happen.
Unchecking "Stop Steam after game exits" for the first log-in and checking it back helps, but it should work without touching it. Doing that can also be quite inconvenient for users who don't use "Remember Me" option during log in. It is also possible to log-in without changing that option if it's done fast enough, but that's tricky and annoying, especially with 2-factor authentication enabled.

title: File variable not being updated when using $-notation

milestone.title: 0.5.x
milestone.description: Lutris 0.5 cycle, including all minor versions.

body:
If you write an install script with for instance a `merge` directive, like the one below...

```yaml
files:
- file1: N/A:Please select file
game:
  main_file: file1
installer:
- merge:
    dst: $GAMEDIR
    src: file1
```
the `main_file` will get updated to link to the copied file in `$GAMEDIR`, like it should.

However, if you use a $-notation in front of `file1` in the `merge` part, like below...

```yaml
files:
- file1: N/A:Please select file
game:
  main_file: file1
installer:
- merge:
    dst: $GAMEDIR
    src: $file1
```
the game will install fine, but the `main_file` will not get updated and instead will link to the original file at the source location, and not the copied one.

title: [installer] execute task in installer scripts are quite broken in later versions
body:
When using a blacklisted process, for example `bash` or `sh`, to run a quick script, the lutris thread will wait for 5 minutes and 40 seconds before realizing bash is not running anymore. This is calculated by `WARMUP_TIME + MAX_CYCLES_WITHOUT_CHILDREN * HEARTBEAT_DELAY / 1000`
Example task:
```yaml
  - execute:
      file: /bin/bash
      args: -c 'echo hello world'
```
This will output `[thread]:Processes: external: python3 (9167:S) | excluded: bash (9175:Z)` until that timeout. Some game installers are affected by this, most notably Battle.net and Overwatch installers.
If the script launches a sub-process for about 3 seconds, it will be detected by Lutris and flagged as "yes, the process has started, don't wait 5 minutes of warm-up", so it will "only" take 40 seconds before Lutris continue the install process.
While Lutris waits, it uses 100% cpu.

title: Broken symbolic links when extracting tar files
body:
I recently wrote an install script for The Stanley Parable DRM-free release, which come in a tar-heavy package. When testing it out, I noticed that the symbolic links of the uncompressed tar-file were not honored when extracted.

The symbolic link files are tagged with a `2` type flag in the uncompressed tar as per the spec, but the extracted files are not flagged as symbolic links and become normal text-files, making the game unplayable.

To reproduce, use 
```
- extract:
    file: path/to/file.tar
```
to extract an uncompressed tar-file with symbolic linked files inside.

title: lutris fails to locate user.reg on wine-launch (for unspecified wine-prefix)
body:
Having installed lutris only recently, I tried to make a launcher for a game installed under my default wine-prefix. The launcher fails silently, when I use any one of the default "play game" options, it however works flawlessly when I choose "run EXE inside wine prefix" instead. 

Running lutris with debug-output I discovered the true problem:
```
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:40:22,855 [system]:Executing which wine
ERROR    2016-11-16 16:40:22,864 [jobs]:Error while completing task <bound method wine.prelaunch of <lutris.runners.wine.wine object at 0x7fa011877710>>: Registry 'user.reg' does not exists
<class 'OSError'> Registry 'user.reg' does not exists
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/util/jobs.py", line 29, in target
    result = self.function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/runners/wine.py", line 708, in prelaunch
    prefix_manager.setup_defaults()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/util/wineprefix.py", line 16, in setup_defaults
    self.override_dll("winemenubuilder.exe", "")
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/util/wineprefix.py", line 49, in override_dll
    self.set_registry_key(key, dll, mode)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/util/wineprefix.py", line 33, in set_registry_key
    registry = WineRegistry(self.get_registry_path(key))
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lutris/util/wineregistry.py", line 78, in __init__
    raise OSError("Registry '%s' does not exists" % reg_filename)
```
I figured that the path to my user.reg is underspecified, because the default option for the wineprefix is blank, and that apparently gets carried over to the method responsible of locating the user.reg 

# Workaround
The Problem can be circumvented, by explicitly setting the wineprefix to the default-location **~/.wine**
in the config-menu 

# Spec's
- lutris 0.4.2

title: Regedit isn't detected as stopped
body:
While investigating another issue, I noticed that after executing regedit via the lutris menu, according to the the debug-information lutris won't stop calling  **Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine** (and wine64) once a second, even after closing regedit. 

# Debug-Output

```
[...]
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:28,470 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:28,528 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine64
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:29,971 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:30,021 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine64
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:31,471 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine

DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:34,473 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine
DEBUG    2016-11-16 16:16:34,531 [system]:Executing fuser /usr/bin/wine64
[...]
```

# How to reproduce:

1. right-click any wine-game from the lutris menu
2. choose "wine registry" 
3. the fuser-calls will start to appear in the Debug-Info and the regeditor opens
4. close the regeditor
5. fuser calls will continue to be made, until you exit lutris. 

# Spec's

- lutris 0.4.2
- Ubuntu 14.04-ish system (bodhi) 
- wine-1.9.22 (Staging)

title: Remove "Lutris is already running but seems unresponsive" message
body:
This message box simply does not work the way it should, when clicking "yes", I _still_ have to restart the client once more. 

And I do not see any use case where any user would click "No" as in "No, I don't want to fix my currently broken and unresponsive game client"

This message should not exists, when the interface is unresponsive, it should be restarted silently without any user input.

title: Zip extraction with zipfile module doesn't preserve permissions
body:
This is very problematic now because GOG's Linux installers are zipped and contain from a few to dozens of files that need to be chmodx'ed after extraction in the lutris script.

The issue [has been reported](https://bugs.python.org/issue15795) upstream in 2012, there's a patch and some slow progress but it's not finalized. 

We can't wait for this to be fixed upstream and available on everyone's system so we should find a workaround. Here's a few ideas:
- Apply the patch and bundle the patched module
- Use unzip (add as dependency to the client)
- Use unzip (bundle binary and run it in the runtime if necessary)

title: libatk missing in the runtime prevents Dwarf Fortress to run
body:
That's on Ubuntu 14.04.

I think libatk is some secondary dependency to GTK3 or Glib, I don't remember well. What I do remember is that I spent a lot of time on that lib, it was kind of the last piece of the GTK3 / Glib puzzle but it didn't have the right shape... if I added it, some games and emulators complained, if I removed it, some other games and emulators complained. 

I believe the only way to fix this would be to patch the libs from the GTK3 / Glib chain that have hardcoded dependencies. Like Valve did with GTK2 and their older version of Glib.

title: Osmose wants a more recent version of libstdc++ than Ubuntu 14.04 has
body: The best would be to have another build made against Ubuntu 14.04 or older.

title: N64 emulation will not work
body:
N64 games will not play as I get this error

"UI-Console Error: dlopen('/usr/local/lib/libmupen64plus.so.2') failed: /usr/local/lib/libmupen64plus.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
UI-Console Error: dlopen('./libmupen64plus.so.2') failed: libminizip.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
UI-Console Error: AttachCoreLib() Error: failed to find Mupen64Plus Core library
ERROR    2015-08-31 21:48:12,340 [thread]:Could not kill PID 32380"

However when I use the version of Mupen64Plus from the software centre it works fine,
I managed to resolve the issue with libmupen64plus.so.2 by creating a symbolic link but I have not managed to fix the issue with libminizip.so.1

I managed to do a simple work-around so that Lutris uses the version of Mupen64Plus from the software centre by replacing .local/share/lutris/runners/mupen64plus/mupen64plus with this shell script.
# !/bin/sh
# 

mupen64plus "$1" "$2"

title: cant play any games
body:
Hi
I have installed lutris in archlinux (tried both normal and git version)
When I open any game added to lutris the window that opens ,closes very fast after opening.
and in lutris it says the game is running.

I see in the Ksysguard that the game runner is running in zommbie mode.

how do I fix this?

title: Clicking the "Install" or "Manage Versions" button of any runner will make the same button appear for the last runner (o2em)
body:
Reproduce:
1. Open the `Manage versions` dialog for Wine,
2. Close it,
3. Scroll down the runners list, O2EM should have a `Manage versions` button instead of `Install` or nothing (if it's installed).

I've spent an hour or so on this and I'm still puzzled as to how this can happen.

title: Lutris does not manage to terminate wineserver after quitting a wine game
body:
Disclaimer: I'm not an expert in process management, so maybe this bug report is invalid, I'll let you see.

I've noticed that wineserver is still running after I quit a wine game in Lutris.
I've done the following test:

Before starting the game:

```
$ pidof wineserver
(nothing)
```

I start the game, Lutris shows a empires2.EXE process with PID 14815, while wineserver is on 14818.

```
$ pidof wineserver
14818
```

After I quit the game properly from the game's main menu, the Lutris console output is frozen on:

```
14815   S       empires2.EXE
14815   S       empires2.EXE
14815   Z       empires2.EXE
```

wineserver is still running with PID 14818 as above.
After a while wineserver jumps to PID 14917.

If I click the "Stop game" button in Lutris, I get this addition to the lutris terminal output:

```
ERROR    2015-04-06 12:27:00,099 [process]:Could not kill process 14952
```

wineserver is still running, I need to kill it manually.

HTH :-)

title: Installation procedures should continue when downloaded file is already in cache
body:
When trying to patch Age of Empires II: Age of Kings (with an edited installer to remove the "requires" field because of #172), I get the following error if I already have the required patch in my cache:

```
Error("Destination path '/home/akien/.cache/lutris/aokpatch2a-crk.exe' already exists",)
```

Lutris should be able to handle this without throwing an error, and continue the installation (maybe by forcing the overwrite of the cached file, since the new one is downloaded anyway).

title: lsof is not always in the user's $PATH
body:
On my system (Mageia 5, 64bit), I get this kind of errors when running lutris from a terminal:

```
ERROR    2015-04-04 16:51:10,104 [system]:Could run command ['lsof', '-t', '/home/akien/.local/share/lutris/runners/wine/1.7.39-i386/bin/wine']: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```

It seems indeed that on my distro, the lsof binary is located in /usr/sbin/lsof, i.e. it's not in the user's $PATH but it's meant to be used by root. I can't tell if it's a packaging mistake in Mageia, but at least Fedora also has lsof in /usr/sbin instead of /usr/bin.

Even if it's not in the $PATH, you should be able to call explicitly /usr/sbin/lsof with user privileges though, but then you need to find a way that would work both on distros with lsof in /usr/bin or in /usr/sbin (maybe use a `try` block to check the PATH first and if not fallback to /usr/sbin?).

title: "requires" installer option not working properly in dev branch
body:
After discussing it with @Xodetaetl and doing some debugging myself, it looks like the "requires" installer option is not working properly in the current master and next branches.

I'm writing an installer for Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne which depends on having Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos installed. The latter is provided via: https://lutris.net/games/install/warcraft-iii-reign-of-chaos-cd-with-opengl.yml

For TFT, I use something similar:

```
description: CD or download version.
exe: drive_c/Program Files/Warcraft III/Frozen Throne.exe
files:
- {setup: 'N/A:Select the installer for Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne'}
game: {prefix: $GAMEDIR}
game_slug: warcraft-iii-the-frozen-throne
installer:
- task: {description: 'Installing Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne', executable: setup,
    name: wineexec, prefix: $GAMEDIR}
- move: {dst: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Warcraft III/Movies_, src: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program
      Files/Warcraft III/Movies/*}
name: 'Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne'
notes: Ingame videos are disabled (by adding an underscore to the movies folder name)
  to avoid crashing.
runner: wine
slug: warcraft-iii-the-frozen-throne-cd-with-opengl
requires: warcraft-iii-reign-of-chaos
steamid: null
version: CD (with OpenGL)
year: 2003
```

I tried using both the "slug" and the "game_slug" of Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos, but none will work with the latest master and next branches. I just get told that I need to install ${game_,}slug even though I already have it installed.

I tried with lutris 0.3.6.3, and there the "requires" parameter works fine when using the target's "game_slug".

title: Marathon fails to launch due to changes to process management
body:
Marathon uses this on the command line to launch : `Marathon\ \(A1\)`
But now that we're passing the command as a list instead of a string to Popen, some special cases like this don't work anymore because special chars are escaped somehow. The command arg here ends up as `Marathon\\ \\(A1\\)`

Another case that's failing is when the args contain `--switch="/path with/some spaces/"`, then due to our code the arg gets split where there is a space, and then the quotes aren't taken into account anyway, or something like that. :)

title: Xrandr output parsing failure
body:

title: [Feature Request] Make Lutris Runtime Optional On Program Startup
body:
This would mainly be beneficially in SteamOS. With the most recent update to Lutris, my Wine games no longer work when launched from Steam. It seems like the biggest problem is due to steamcompmgr requiring the use of the library gameoverlayrenderer.so. When I try to run FlatOut 2 or System Shock 2 from Steam, I get the following error when the Lutris Runtime is enabled.

```
/home/steam/.local/share/lutris/runners/wine/1.7.29-i386/bin/wine: /lib/i386-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.18' not found (required by /home/steam/.local/share/lutris/runtime/lib32/libstdc++.so.6)
```

The Steam Runtime is not being utilized in either script. I have tried it with the Steam Runtime enabled and that doesn't work either; it gets a little further but Wine still fails to work. Assigning a blank string to LD_LIBRARY_PATH before launching Lutris doesn't help. When I assign a blank string to LD_PRELOAD in order to disable the use of the gameoverlayrenderer.so library, Wine is able to run but the window is not seen by steamcompmgr and keyboard input is not passed. It seems that using the gameoverlayrenderer.so library is required in order for the session to work as intended.

```
Original LD_LIBRARY_PATH:
/home/steam/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32:/home/steam/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_64

Original LD_PRELOAD:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libmodeswitch_inhibitor.so:/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libmodeswitch_inhibitor.so:/home/steam/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/gameoverlayrenderer.so:/home/steam/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_64/gameoverlayrenderer.so
```

Just like Steam gives you the option to disable the Steam Runtime using an environmental variable, having a similar option in Lutris might be helpful here and in other situations. For right now, I have the portion of code that places the Lutris Runtime in LD_LIBRARY_PATH commented out.

title: Editing game titles breaks the synchronization
body:
Modifying a game's title in the config dialog also changes the slug, which:
1. Unsyncs the game, effectively changing the icon (generally to the default icon since the new slug probably doesn't correspond to any game on the server) and preventing install of the game from the client
2. Makes Lutris recreate another game entry with the initial slug and title on library sync, if the game is still in the remote library

It's not expected. Editing the game title should only be cosmetic.
If you want a way to sync the game to a different remote game, the feature should be done differently.

title: Wine does not respect Virtual desktop wine runner setting. No Default desktop defined in registry.
body:
This is more of a question than a real issue. Since the wine runner allows a user to specify whether a virtual desktop should be used in Wine, I would think that changing the setting in Lutris would be all that is needed to make it work. However, there is no way in Lutris to write a value to HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Wine\Explorer\Desktops\Default with the resolution that you want to use for the virtual desktop. Without that, Wine will not run an application in a virtual desktop. Either winecfg would have to be run from the command line or winetricks would have to be used in order to write the appropriate value to the registry.

Is this acceptable behavior or should a new option be added to the wine runner?

title: Launching a binary not marked as executable fails
body: Lutris should either mark it as executable and launch, or ask permission from the user and do it, or ask the user to do it himself.
